entries: Also at 1st level, you gain the ability to channel — or sometimes sacrifice — a part of your vital essence to curse and manipulate creatures through hemocraft magic. You know one blood curse of your choice, detailed in the "{@filter Blood Curses|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Blood Curse}" section at the end of the class description. You learn one additional blood curse of your choice at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level. Each time you learn a new blood curse, you can also choose one of the blood curses you know and replace it with another blood curse.

Each time you use your Blood Maledict feature, you choose which curse to invoke from the curses you know. While invoking a blood curse, but before it affects the target, you can choose to amplify the curse by taking necrotic damage equal to one roll of your hemocraft die. This damage can't be reduced in any way. An amplified curse gains an additional effect, noted in the curse's description. Creatures that do not have blood are immune to blood curses unless you have amplified the curse.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. You can use Blood Maledict twice between rests starting at 6th level, three times starting at 13th level, and four times starting at 17th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite
entries: Also at 2nd level, you learn to invoke a rite of hemocraft that infuses your weapon strikes with elemental energy. As a bonus action, you can activate any rite you know on one weapon you're holding. The effect of the rite lasts until you finish a short or long rest. When you activate a rite, you take necrotic damage equal to one roll of your hemocraft die. This damage can't be reduced in any way.

While the rite is in effect, attacks you make with this weapon are magical, and deal extra damage equal to your hemocraft die of the type determined by the chosen rite. A weapon can hold only one active rite at a time. Other creatures can't gain the benefit of your rite.
You choose one rite from the crimson rites below when you first gain this feature. You learn an additional crimson rite at 7th level, and again at 14th level.

entries.name: Rite of the Flame
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is fire damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Frozen
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is cold damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Storm
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is lightning damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Dead
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is necrotic damage. (Prerequisite: 14th level)

entries.name: Rite of the Oracle
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is psychic damage. (Prerequisite: 14th level)

entries.name: Rite of the Roar
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is thunder damage. (Prerequisite: 14th level)

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order
entries: At 3rd level, you commit to an order of blood hunters whose philosophy will guide you throughout your life: the Order of the Ghostslayer, the Order of the Lycan, the Order of the Mutant, or the Order of the Profane Soul, each of which is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 7th level and again at 11th, 15th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Brand of Castigation
entries: At 6th level, when you damage a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you can channel hemocraft magic to sear an arcane brand into that creature (no action required). You always know the direction to the branded creature as long as it's on the same plane as you. Further, each time the branded creature deals damage to you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you, the branded creature takes psychic damage equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of 1).

Your brand lasts until you dismiss it or until you use this feature to apply a brand to another creature. Your brand can be dispelled with {@spell dispel magic|phb}, and is treated as a spell with a level equal to half your blood hunter level (maximum 9th level).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature twice between rests.

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite Improvement
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional Crimson Rite.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Grim Psychometry
entries: When you reach 9th level, you gain a supernatural talent for discerning the secrets surrounding mysterious relics or places touched by evil. Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check to recall information about the sinister or tragic history of an object you are touching or your current location, you have advantage on the check. At the DM's discretion, a suitably high roll might cause your character to experience brief visions of the past connected to the object or location.

classFeature.name: Dark Augmentation
entries: Starting at 10th level, the magic of hemocraft suffuses your body to permanently reinforce your resilience. Your speed increases by 5 feet, and you have a bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of +1).

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Brand of Tethering
entries: Starting at 13th level, the psychic damage from your Brand of Castigation increases to twice your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of 2). Additionally, a branded creature can't take the Dash action, and if it attempts to teleport or to leave its current plane by any means, it takes {@dice 4d6} psychic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the attempt to teleport or leave the plane fails.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature three times between rests.

classFeature.name: Hardened Soul
entries: When you reach 14th level, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite Improvement
entries: At 14th level, you learn an additional Crimson Rite.

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature four times between rests.

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Sanguine Mastery
entries: Upon reaching 20th level, your mastery of blood magic reaches its height, mitigating your sacrifice and empowering your expertise. Once per turn, whenever a blood hunter feature requires you to roll a hemocraft die, you can reroll the die and use either roll.
Additionally, whenever you score a critical hit with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you regain one expended use of your Blood Maledict feature.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a practioner of occult magic, you have inherited and developed techniques to manipulate reality through mediums of rituals, spirits, elements, and more. See {@book Spells Rules|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for the {@filter Occultist spell list|spells|class=Occultist}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the Occultist spell list. You learn additional Occultist cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Occultist table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Occultist table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Occultist spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell witch bolt|PHB|witchbolt} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast witchbolt using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know four 1st-level spells of your choice from the Occultist spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Occultist table shows when you learn more Occultist spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the table. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Occultist spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Occultist spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Occultist spells. Your magic comes from a practitioners knowledge of traditional, ritual, and the way things work learned through experience, care and cunning. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Occultist spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any Occultist spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an occult fetish as a spellcasting focus for your Occultist spells.

entries.name: Occult Fetish
entries: Similar to a {@item Holy Symbol|PHB} or an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB}, an Occult Fetish is a magical focus, but one that functions for the Occultist.
It can be almost anything, though usually has a somewhat macabre bent, such as a skull decorated with feathers or pendant decorated with teeth and runes.
You can buy or make one for 10 gp, and it typically weighs about 1 lb.

There are many inconsistencies between the spell list in the occultist class, the occultist spell list in Kibble's Casting Compendium, and the tags on spells printed in either source document. Of note is the 'Sudden Hazards' spell, which appears in the class spell list, but is not printed in either brew. For simplicity's sake, if it says it's an occultist spell somewhere in an up-to-date source, it's tagged as an occultist spell in this brew.

classFeature.name: Occult Tradition
entries: Choose an occult tradition, shaping your the techniques, features, and rites available to you from the following: Oracle, Shaman, or Witch.
Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level, 3rd level, 6th level, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Occult Rites
entries: As you delve into your Tradition of occult magic, you find deviations and branches to explore that help you specialize and perfect your craft in the way that best suits you.

At 2nd Level, you gain two {@filter Occult Rites|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=ktor} of your choice. Your Occult Rites options are detailed at the end of the subclass description for subclass specific Rites, and at the end of the class description for general Rites, you can select from either you subclass or class list. When you gain certain Occultist levels, you gain additional Occult Rites of your choice.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Occult Rites you know and replace it with another Occult Rites that you could learn at that level. A level prerequisite in a Occult Rite refers to Occultist level, not character level.

entries.name: Class and Subclass Rites
entries: Each occult tradition has specific rites that only they can select, and for each tradition, these are added to the pool of rites with the class rites you can select. You can select from either list when you are selecting a new rite.

entries.name: Losing Invested Objects
entries: If a Rite creates an object, you can recreate that object if it is lost or destroyed. If the rules are not specified elsewhere, it is a process that requires any base object the Rite did and 4 hours of time. If the original still exists anywhere, it loses its magical properties when you complete this process.

classFeature.name: Occult Tradition feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature from your Occult Tradition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Occult Tradition feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Occult Tradition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Traditional Expertise
entries: Starting at 10th level, your passed down knowledge of tradition gives you expertise in a skill of your tradition; choose one of your skill proficiencies from {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Survival}. Your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that use of the chosen Proficiency. If you have proficiency in none of the selected skills, you can instead gain proficiency in one of your choice.
Additionally, when you make a Wisdom ability check, you can draw upon your Tradition and expend a spell slot to gain advantage on the check.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you make a Wisdom ability check

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Occult Tradition feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Occult Tradition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: The Old Ways
entries: At 20th level, your mastery of ritual and tradition is extensive and unparalleled, you've unlocked ancient secrets and perfected techniques to master rituals completely. Any Occultist spell you know of 3rd level or lower becomes a ritual spell for you. When you cast a spell without the ritual tag as a ritual, it requires additional consumed material components worth 10 gold per level of the spell.

Additionally, your mastery of rituals allows you to work them more quickly. A spell cast as a ritual only takes additional turns equal to the spell's level to cast (for example, casting a 3rd level spell as a ritual would take four turns to cast, casting as your action or bonus action on the fourth turn). Spells with a casting time of a reaction cannot be cast as a ritual.

classFeature.name: Arcane Surge
entries: Your affinity for magic gives you a pool of Arcane Surges. Once during your turn, you can expend a use of Arcane Surge to do any of the following:
* Cast detect magic without expending a spell slot.
* Gain advantage on an attack roll (no action required)
* Add your Intelligence modifier to a Strength or Dexterity ability check (no action required).
Teleport up 5 feet to an unoccupied space you can see (no action required). This distance increases by 5 feet at 5th (10 feet), 9th (15 feet), 13th (20 feet), and 17th (25 feet) levels.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You can regain expended uses when you complete a short or long rest. As you level, you may gain additional uses for your Arcane Surges, but can still only spend a single use of Arcane Surge a turn.

classFeature.name: Magic Trick
entries: Additionally at 1st level , you learn one cantrip of your choice from the Spellblade class list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As part of your study of magic, you gain the ability to cast spells at 2nd level. The spells you learn are limited in scope, primarily concerned with enhancing your abilities and devastating your foes.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 2nd level, you learn additional two cantrips of your choice from the Spellblade spell list. You learn additional Spellblade cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Spellblade table. The table includes the bonus cantrips gained from Spellblade class features (such as Empowered Strike)

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Spellblade table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Spellblade spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of your Spellblade spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the Spellblade spell list. The Spells Known column of the Spellblade table shows when you learn more Spellblade spells of your choice.
Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Spellblade spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Spellblade spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your Spellblade spells.

classFeature.name: Spellstrike
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can infuse spells into your weapon. As a bonus action, you can cast a 1st level or higher Spellblade spell with a casting time of 1 action in a special way, infusing it into a melee weapon instead of having it immediately take effect. The next time you make a melee attack with that weapon before the end of your turn, the spell is cast against the target of the attack. The spell fizzles and fails to cast if you cast another spell before attacking.
Spellstrike's interaction with the spell mechanics is determined by the spell's effect:
* If the spell requires an attack roll (melee or ranged) it automatically hits the target if the weapon attack hits and misses the target if the weapon attack misses.

* If the spell has a saving throw, it automatically deals damage as if they failed saving throw against the spell on hit, but if it has any effects besides dealing damage, the target makes the save against those effects as normal for being targeted by the spell (regardless if the attack hits or misses). If a spell does half damage to targets that pass their save, they take half damage on a missed attack, treating it as if they had passed their saving throw. If a spell always hits (such as magic missile), the spell hits regardless if you hit or miss your attack.

* If the spell has an area of effect, that area of effect must include the space the target of the Spellstrike is in, be placed such that one one edge of it is within the range of your weapon, and otherwise follows the rules of the spell regarding placement and range. Other creatures caught in the area of effect treat the spell as if you had cast it normally. The target is not affected by the spell again (having already resolved as part of the attack).

Spells that have multiple attack rolls (such as scorching ray or crackle ) tie the outcome of only the first attack roll to the melee weapon attack. You resolve all subsequent attack rolls of the spell as if you had cast the spell, but can ignore the disadvantage on ranged attack rolls from being within 5 feet of hostile creatures when doing so.

You can only cast spells that are on the Spellblade class list using Spellstrike, and can only cast them at a level you can cast them as a Spellblade, though you can use any spell slot you have available to cast the spell.

classFeature.name: Arcane Deflection
entries: At 2nd level, you learn the shield spell, incorporating it into your Aegis, allowing you to cast it without components, and allowing you to cast it without expending a spell slot once, after which you must expend a spell slot as normal until you complete a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Aegis
entries: Additionally at 2nd level, you start to form a magical Aegis that enhances your physical powers with magical powers, blending them together. You can select one 1st level Aegis effect (listed at the end of the class) and gain the effects

When you complete a long rest, you can change your selected 1st level Aegis effect or further boost your Aegis by sacrificing spell slots, granting magical empowerments that last until you complete your next long rest. When you do so, select an additional Aegis Effect (listed at the end of the class document) and expend the listed level of spell slot.
You can expend a maximum number of spell levels this way equal to your Spellblade level divided by four (rounded up).
*You can find the list of Aegis Effects in the Optional Features tab.

classFeature.name: Spellblade Technique
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you select a specialization for your powers. You can choose from the Battlemage, Aether Blade, Guardian, Mage Hunter, Swiftblade, or Spellshot techniques, each of which grants you additional features
Your choice grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 15th, and 20th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Empowered Strike
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can use cantrips on the Spellblade class list with your Spellstrike feature.

You learn 2 additional cantrips of your choice, selecting the options from the Spellblade cantrip list, and an additional cantrip at 9th, 13th, and 17th level (these additional cantrips are included on the Spellblade table).

classFeature.name: Arcane Recuperation
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain the ability to regain some of your magical energy through a quick focused meditation. When you finish a short rest, you regain some of your expended spell slots. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than one third of your Spellblade level (rounded down). You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Additionally, at any time, as a bonus action you can expend a spell slot to regain Arcane Surges equal to the level of spell slots spent.

classFeature.name: Magical Warding
entries: Additionally at 6th level, you gain proficiency in your choice of Wisdom or Charisma saving throws, and you automatically succeed on saving throws against your own spells.

classFeature.name: Spellblade Technique feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spellblade Technique.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Archetypal Magic
entries: At 10th level, you can cast each of the spells granted by your Spellblade technique without expending a spell slot once. After you cast a spell that way, you cannot cast it that way again until you complete a long rest.

classFeature.name: Expanded Aegis
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you finish a long rest you can select an additional 1st Level Aegis Effect to gain the benefit of without expending a spell slot. This effect lasts until you complete a long rest, at which time you can select a new effect.
At 14th level, you can additionally select one 2nd level Aegis Effect this way, and at 18th level, you can additionally select one 3rd level Aegis effect this way.

classFeature.name: Splash Damage
entries: Beginning at 11th level, when you hit a creature with Spellstrike, the target and creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the target that would be hit by the same attack roll take 1d8 additional force damage. On a miss, the target takes half as much damage, and nearby creatures take no damage (even if the attack roll would have hit them)

classFeature.name: Blast Zone Immunity
entries: Starting at 11th level, you are immune to the area of effect of your own spells. You take no damage from them, and ignore all other affects unless you choose to be affected.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Surging Focus
entries: Starting at 14th level, if you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you can spend an Arcane Surge to succeed instead.

classFeature.name: Magical Sensitivity
entries: Additionally at 14th level, you learn the detect magic spell, and it does not count against your spells known, and the detect magic spell no longer requires concentration for you.

For the duration of detect magic, you gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. If you are already proficient in the Arcana skill, for the duration you gain expertise, allowing you to add double your proficiency bonus to ability checks made using the Arcana skill.

classFeature.name: Spellblade Technique feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spellblade Technique.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Blast Zone Control
entries: At 18th level, when use Spellstrike to cast a spell that affects an area of effect, you can expend a use of your Arcane Surge expand the effect of your Blast Zone Immunity to a number of allies equal to your Intelligence modifier. When used this way, it only protects your allies until the start of your next turn, at which point they go back to being affected by any ongoing effects of a spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Spellblade Technique feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spellblade Technique.

feat.name: Arcane Conduit

prerequisite.other: The ability to cast at least one spell

entries: You have developed a synaptic link between yourself and your companion, working in tandem to achieve arcane mastery. You gain the following benefit:

On your turn, as a bonus action you can create a link between yourself and a bonded companion within 100 feet. Until the end of your next turn, the next spell you would cast is cast by your companion instead. Use your companion's location to determine range and visibility of targets. Your companion automatically provides all verbal, somatic and material components without a gold cost. If the spell uses an attack roll, spell saving throw, or similar requirement, it uses your modifiers.

feat.name: Beast Tamer
entries: You have a great ability to communicate with, and command, beasts. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill, if you don't already have it.

If you succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check on a beast, the subject of your check serves you for one hour. The beast can perform simple tasks, such as carry messages, guard doorways, or serve as a mount.

feat.name: Cannoneer
entries: Your familiarity with {@object ballista|DMG|ballistas}, {@object cannon|DMG|cannons}, and other heavy mounted weaponry grants you the following benefits:

items: You can load, aim, or fire a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} as a bonus action on your turn.
When a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} you loaded deals damage, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.
When a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} that you aimed is fired, you can add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll.
When you fire a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon}, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the ranged weapon attack roll.
If you spend 1 minute repairing a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon}, it regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your level.

feat.name: Conductive Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct lightning spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell create or destroy water|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot or providing material components. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
When you cast a spell using hydromancy, you can treat any bodies of water that are less than 10 feet apart at any point as a single body of water.
When you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.

Once per turn when you deal lightning damage to a creature with a spell cast using hydromancy, you can cause it to take an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage, or {@damage 1d12} lightning damage if the creature is submerged in water.

feat.name: Cornered Combatant
entries: You've gained an almost animalistic wrath when you're pushed to your limits. In tough circumstances, your adrenaline bolsters your strength so you can live to see another day.

items: Strength score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have a +1 to damage rolls made while you have less than half of your maximum hit points.

feat.name: Deep Diver
entries: You've spent more than a natural amount of time underwater, and your lungs have grown to hold more air. In addition, you've become more adept at handling your movements while swimming.

items: The amount of time you can hold your breath is tripled.
You gain a swimming speed equal to half of your base movement speed.

feat.name: Exotic Rider
entries: Your boldness truly knows no bounds, and you've taken interest in riding more than just horses and ponies. If it's bigger than you, and you can hold on tight, why not try to ride it?

items: You can ride any beast, provided it is at least one size category larger than you.
You have advantage on {@skill Animal Handling} (Wisdom) checks made to calm your mount or attempt risky maneuvers.

feat.name: Expert Fisherman
entries: Experienced in the behavior and motions of aquatic prey, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence (Nature), Wisdom (Animal Handling), and Wisdom (Survival) checks made when interacting with aquatic creatures.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to spot creatures and phenomena underwater.
When you make an attack at a target that is submerged in water on your turn in combat, you can use a bonus action to steady your aim in order to gain advantage on the attack roll.
If you are proficient with nets, you can add your proficiency bonus to the DC for the Strength check required to free a creature from a net you threw.

feat.name: Fanatical Devotion
entries: Your intense worship and piety grant you the following benefits:

items: When you create a {@creature kuo-toa idol} using God Making, it remains for 8 hours instead of 1 hour, and is created with a number of temporary hit points equal to your level.

While you are within 10 feet of your {@creature kuo-toa idol} and can see  it, you have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and can't be {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

feat.name: Firearms Expert
entries: Thanks to substantial practice with firearms, you gain the following benefits:

items: You ignore the loading quality of {@filter firearms|items|type=firearm} with which you are proficient.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with a {@filter one-handed weapon|items|type=Melee Weapon|property=!Two-handed}, you can use a bonus action to attack with a loaded {@item pistol} you are holding.

feat.name: Firearms Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with one or more firearms, and mastered the use of smokepowder in these weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item pistol} and {@item musket}.

feat.name: Greater Magical Bond
entries: Adventurers who spend enough time with their familiars as companions find certain loopholes in the find familiar spell's function, allowing their companion even greater strength.

items: Your familiar can take the attack action on its turn.
You can dismiss or summon your familiar as a bonus action.

feat.name: Heavy Carapace
entries: Your carapace hardens and grows more dense, granting you the following benefits:

items: Your weight doubles.

When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws made against effects that would push you or knock you {@condition prone}.
Your pincers gain the heavy property, and you can deal bludgeoning or slashing damage (your choice) equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Strength modifier when you hit with them.

feat.name: Lord of the Herd
entries: You've discovered how to perfectly manage your relationship with a network of companions, and are even able to take on another.

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You can have up to four companions, and your Bond Strength with each of them is instead limited to 14.

feat.name: Magical Bond
entries: The bond between you and your companion transcends material limits, and takes on a magical strength.

items: You learn the find familiar spell if you don't already know it.

Instead of choosing a creature from the find familiar spell's list, you can instead choose a willing companion whose Bond Strength with you is 12 or higher. The creature retains the statistics, type, and appearance it had before the spell was cast. If you cast the spell on another creature, or change its form, the companion instead loses the benefits from the spell. If it is in a demiplane when you do this, it appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.
Your familiar's maximum hit points are increased by a number equal to your caster level.

feat.name: Master Trainer
entries: You've become a master of expanding your companion's abilities, and have learned more effective ways to teach it.

items: You and your companions have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made during ability training.
Your companion with the highest Bond Strength can improve its ability scores by a total equal to 14 instead of 10.

feat.name: Navigator
entries: You have developed the skills necessary to assist navigation at land and sea. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have proficiency in {@item navigator's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient in {@item navigator's tools|phb}, you can add a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier to any checks made while using them.
If you can see the stars or sun, you know which way is north.
You can tell which way the weather, including wind and temperature, is going to turn in the next 24 hours.

feat.name: Net Master
entries: Extensive training with {@item net|phb|nets} has earned you the following benefits:

items: You don't suffer disadvantage when attack a creature within 5 feet of you with a net, or when throwing a net up to its long range.
You can add your proficiency bonus to the DC, AC, and damage requirement for escaping or destroying your nets.
When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a {@filter one-handed weapon|items|type=Melee Weapon|property=!Two-handed} you are holding.

feat.name: Occult Specialist
entries: You delve deeper into your tradition perfecting a new rite. You can select an {@filter Occult Rite|optionalfeatures|source=BelzorMM|feature type=ktor} from the Occultist class Occult Rite list. You cannot select a rite you already know, or one that requires a level restriction, even if you are already of that level. You can only select one from a subclass list if you are have at least one level in that subclass.

feat.name: Rime Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct your hydromancy through ice and snow, and to direct cold spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell water walk|PHB} spell and cast it once without expending a spell slot or providing material components. When you cast the spell in this way, it is only capable of targeting yourself, only allows you to move across the surface of liquid water, and leaves shards of ice in your wake. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
You can treat a body of snow or ice as a body of water when casting spells with the hydromancy tag.
When you cast a spell that deals cold damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.
While you are fully submerged in water, you have resistance to cold damage.

feat.name: Sea Legs
entries: Your time spent aboard boats has earned you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in {@filter vehicles (water)|items|type=Vehicle (water)}
You have advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.
Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.

feat.name: Siege Expert
entries: You have spent significant time operating siege equipment, earning you the following benefits:

items: You add your proficiency bonus to attack and damage rolls using siege weapons.
If a siege weapon would require an action to aim, you can use a bonus action instead.
During a short rest, provided you have access to {@item carpenter's tools|phb} or similar equipment, you can restore {@dice 1d10} hit points to a siege weapon.

feat.name: Spear Specialist
entries: You have trained to become a deadly warrior with pole weapons, capable of making lunging attacks and long-distance throws. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use a {@item javelin|phb}, {@item spear|phb}, or {@item trident|phb}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}, and from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10} when wielded with two hands, if possible (this feature has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die).
As a bonus action, you can extend the reac of your javelin, spear, or trident by 5 feet.
You can make a ranged attack with a javelin, spear, or trident up to its long range without disadvantage, even underwater.

feat.name: Steam Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct your hydromancy spells through water vapor, and to direct fire spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell fog cloud|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
You can treat an area of fog, mist, or steam as a body of water when casting spells with the hydromancy tag.
When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.
Fire damage dealt by spells you cast using hydromancy ignores resistance granted from being underwater.

feat.name: Stoic
entries: You are resilient to fear-incuding effects, and are stoic in the face of horror. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition frightened} or gaining madness effects.

feat.name: Submariner
entries: Your time spent training beneath the waves has earned you the following benefits:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You add your proficiency bonus to the number of minutes for which you can hold your breath.
You add a your proficiency bonus to the number of rounds you can survive after running out of breath.

feat.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Experienced with shifting terrain or the rocking and swaying of ships out at sea, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

When a creature within 5 feet of you fails an ability check or saving throw against an effect that would knock it {@condition prone}, you can use your reaction to allow the creature to reroll the ability check or saving throw if you have at least one hand free.

feat.name: Swimmer
entries: You have undergone extensive aquatic training to gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed.
You can hold your breath a number of minutes equal to 2 + twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 minute).
When you fall into water, you take no bludgeoning damage from the fall if you are not {@condition incapacitated}.
You can't be knocked {@condition prone} while you are underwater.

feat.name: Trail Expert
entries: You've learned the complex truth that there are no living things that can't be tracked. Once you've caught the scent of a trail, your quarry is as good as found.

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track a creature.
While navigating, you instantly know the moment you are lost.

feat.name: Underwater Archer
entries: You have spent extensive time using ranged weapons under water, and have mastered their trajectories:

items: Your ranged weapon attacks do not automatically mis beyond their normal range underwater.
You don't suffer disadvantage while making ranged weapon attacks within their normal range underwater.

hazard.name: Water Pressure
entries: Some locations beneath the ocean are so deep that water pressure becomes a problem. Creatures and vehicles at a depth of 3,000 feet or lower take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage per minute from water pressure unless they are adapted or built to withstand this environment. Storm giants, whales, sharks, crustaceans, and aquatic invertebrates are immune to water pressure at this depth, as are vehicles with a damage threshold of 10 or higher.

Other creatures might be immune to the effect of water pressure at your discretion. Typically, a magic item that gives its wearer the ability to breathe water also protects it from deep-sea pressures.

entries.name: Crew
entries: The caravel has a crew of eight {@creature lizardfolk}, two {@creature ogre|mm|ogres}, and five human {@creature thug|mm|thugs}.

entries.name: Weaponry
entries: The caravel is armed with {@object side-shears|BelzorMM} and two {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae}.

items.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

items.name: Side-shears
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage.

item.name: Aslaug Waveborn's Spear
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Waterborne
entries: This item floats on water and other liquids. Its bearer has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to swim.

item.name: Asteroid Belt
entries: Constructed from a string of seemingly unattached stones, this belt is held together by magical force. It has 7 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the belt, you can use an action to expend any number of charges to attack one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The belt launches a flaming stone bead and makes its attack roll with a +7 bonus. On a hit, for each charge you spend, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 5 feet away from you.

item.name: Bag of Teeth
entries: This small sack is made of fish skin and contains a handful of quipper teeth. As an action, you can open the bag and scatter its contents in a body of water, creating a {@creature swarm of quippers|MM} which lasts for 10 minutes.

The swarm is hostile toward every creature. Roll initiative for the swarm, which has its own turns. On its turn, the swarm moves towards the nearest creature it can see and attacks it. If the swarm can't attack a creature on its turn, it instead takes the Dash action toward the nearest creature it can see. If the swarm can't see any creatures, it does nothing on its turn.

item.name: Bailing Twine
entries: This 50-foot length of hempen rope weighs 10 pounds. If one end of the rope is dipped into water, the rope absorbs and ejects the water out the other end at a rate of 1 gallon per round, or 10 gallons per minute.

item.name: Bantering Blade
entries: This well-worn cutlass is a veteran of hundreds of voyages across the seas. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can have the sword unleash a string of magical insults at the target, often with nautical allusions or crude humor. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The sword is a sentient chaotic neutral item with an Intelligence of 10, a Wisdom of 9, and a Charisma of 14. It has hearing and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 10 feet.
The sword can speak, read, and understand Common. It communicates verbally, and its voice is slurred and theatrical.

entries.name: Personality
entries: The sword possess a vicious wit, enthusiastically mocking any that it strikes. It punctuates its attacks with verbal jabs and curses, questioning its opponent's honor, skill, or physical appearance. The sword prefers high adventures with good friends, and often voices support for decisions that lead to great exploits and dramatic duels.

item.name: Baragsh's +3 Adamantine Glaive
entries: A {@item +3 adamantine glaive|BelzorMM} whose green blade is banded and mottled in a pattern reminiscent of astral skies. It belonged to Baragsh—a male orc captain of a spacefaring vessel from the Astral Plane. A creature attuned to the weapon gains proficiency in vehicles (air), and can add their proficiency bonus to checks made to navigate in the Astral Plane.

entries.name: +3 Adamantine Glaive
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

item.name: Beast Snatcher
entries: This small crystal orb uses long-lost magic that converts matter into compacted wavelengths of light. It is a smooth, crystalline ball with a steel ring wrapped around it, and a stone valve that can be pressed to capture or release a creature. The orb weighs 1 pound.

As an action, you can make a ranged attack to throw the orb at a creature within 20 feet of you. If the creature is CR 1/2 or lower, it must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity or Strength saving throw (whichever score is higher), or be consumed by the orb.

The beast snatcher can be used to attempt to capture a new beast once per day, and resets at dawn. Creatures summoned by other creatures, such as elementals or undead, have advantage on the save. Humanoids are unaffected by the orb, and it can only contain one creature at a time. To release a creature from the orb, the user must unattune to it, at which point the creature automatically reappears within 5 feet of the item.

Once a creature is trapped inside, time ceases to flow for it and it doesn't grow older. If you throw the orb when it contains a creature, the creature reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the ball. The creature then acts as it normally would, as if it had been teleported from where it was first captured.

If a creature has been inside the ball for a cumulative 2d10 days after its initial capture, it gains +4 Bond Strength. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points outside the ball, it must make a DC 10 (or half of the damage taken, whichever is higher) Constitution saving throw. On a success, it is transported back into the crystal with 1 hit point. On a failure, it dies.
{@b At higher rarities:}
Rare: The creature can be CR 1 or lower, and the save to avoid capture becomes 14.
Very rare: The creature can be CR 4 or lower, and the save to avoid capture becomes 16.
Legendary: The creature can be CR 10 or lower, and the save to avoid capture becomes 18.
Artifact: The creature can be any CR, and the save to avoid capture becomes 22.

item.name: Billowing Sailcloth
entries: This white canvas sailcloth is imbued with energy from the Elemental Plane of Air, and can be worn as a billowing cape. When held in both hands, the sailcloth slows your rate of descent to 10 feet per round (falling at the end of each of your turns). It can carry up to 400 pounds, but your rate of descent becomes 30 feet while it is carrying more than 200 pounds. If you let go of the sailcloth with either hand, you immediately fall as normal.

The sailcloth has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the sailcloth, you can use an action to speak the sailcloth's command word, expending 1 to 3 of its charges to create a powerful updraft which propels you upwards a 30 feet for each charge you spend. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

The sailcloth can also be used as a sail for any Large or smaller water vehicle (such as a rowboat). While used in this way, you can use an action to speak the sailcloth's command word, expending 1 to 3 of its charges to cause the sail to billow with wind. For the next 10 minutes, the vehicle's speed  increases by 10 feet per charge expended.

item.name: Black Candle
entries: A black candle with an illusory flame that extinguishes all nonmagical light sources in a room when snuffed.

item.name: Blade of Parting Water
entries: This monolithic bronze blade has the pinkish hue of untarnished copper. Attacks made with this magic weapon don't suffer disadvantage from being underwater.
Whenever this weapon hits a creature with an amorphous form composed of liquid, such as an ooze or {@creature water elemental|MM}, the hit is a critical hit.

This sword has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn. If it is submerged in a river or the sea at dawn, it regains all its charges instead. As an action while wielding this blade, you can expend a charge to strike the earth, sending a blast of power in a 30 foot wide, 90 foot long line. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 15 feet away from the center of the line and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. If the line passes through a body of water, the shockwave pushes the water aside, forming a 30-foot-wide trench. The trench remains until the end of your next turn, after which the water slowly flows back into place.

item.name: Bracers of Brutality
entries: While raging, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
If you have no rages left, you can use a bonus action to take 1d8 piercing damage then enter a rage. Once this feature is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Braziers of Misty Forms
entries: Braziers of misty forms come in pairs, with each silver goblet marked with matching ripple patterns. While you are holding a brazier, you can speak its command word as an action. When you do so, any nonmagical liquid within the brazier instantly transforms into mist, spreading out around you in a 10-foot-radius sphere that lightly obscures the area for 1 minute. The mist takes on the form of each creature or object within 10 feet of the other brazier, moving and shifting as the shapes it represents does for the duration. The other brazier then also activates as if its command word had been spoken.
If the brazier is empty when you speak its command word, it does not produce a mist.
Once you use a brazier in this way, it can't be used again until the next dawn. If one of the braziers is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Bubble Barrier
entries: This fist-sized glass orb glistens iridescent in sunlight. When you take damage or are forced to make a saving throw against an effect that you can see, you can crush the orb as a reaction, destroying it and enveloping you in a protective bubble which functions as an {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere|PHB}, preventing the triggering effect and lasting until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Captain Tharhava Shestendeliath's Scimitar of Speed
entries: A {@item scimitar of speed} that belonged to Captain Tharhava Shestendeliath—a non-binary blue dragonborn swashbuckler. A creature attuned to the weapon becomes obsessively driven by the draconian voice in their mind commanding them to avenge their death at the hands of Tharcereli. The creature cannot unattune to the weapon, and are unwillig to part with it until Tharcereli is killed. In addition, they gain the breath weapon of a blue {@race dragonborn} (see chapter 2 of the {@i Player's Handbook}).

entries.name: Scimitar of Speed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.

item.name: Captain's Lantern
entries: This exquisite brass-and-green glass lantern constantly protects the ship it is mounted on. Until it is removed, the entire ship is under the effect of the {@spell alarm} spell, set to produce the sound of heavy bronze bells ringing when triggered.

If you speak the lantern's command word while touching a copper coin to the underside of the lantern, the coin becomes a token of passage, marked with a depiction of the ship on one of its faces. While a creature is carrying a token, it does not trigger the lantern's alarm. If you speak the lantern's command word while holding a silver coin to the underside of the lantern, all previously created tokens of passage lose their magic and revert to nonmagical copper coins.

A creature that spends 1 minute studying the lantern can attempt to learn the lantern's command word with a successful {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. On a failed check, the {@spell alarm} spell triggers.

item.name: Cephalian Bands
entries: These brass armbands bear the shape of entwined tentacles, lined with veins of black ink. While wearing them, you have advantage on checks made to maintain grapples.

While you are underwater, you can use an action to cast {@spell darkness} from the bands, centered on yourself. When you do so, your speed is doubled until the end of the turn. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Clawed Gauntlet
entries: A character proficient with {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} is considered proficient with the gauntlets.

item.name: Cloak of the Starwalker
entries: Belonging to a mythological thief who was said to have stolen the stars themselves, this cloak offers a window into the void of space. Adorned with a pattern of faintly glowing star-like motes of light, the pattern of the cloak shifts when attuned to reveal a picture of the heavens.
This cloak has 7 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dusk. While wearing the cloak, you can use a bonus action to expend one charge to cast {@spell misty step}.
While attuned to this cloak, you gain resistance to radiant and force damage, you are immune to any ill effects from being in a vacuum, and your movement speed is doubled in dim light or darkness.

item.name: Collar of Translation
entries: This collar is lined with letters and symbols from various languages, and bears the symbol of a mouth at its clasp. While an attuned creature wears the collar, it gains the ability to communicate with a magical voice. When it speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear it understands what it says. The complexity of what it is able to say is based on its Intelligence Score.
1-3: It can speak in single words, such as an emotion it is feeling or an object it is interested in.
4-6: It can speak in short sentences to ask questions, relay what it has seen, or say what it wants.
8-9: It can carry a conversation, and gains the ability to understand one language it has heard before.
10-14: It is able to carry on a conversation and speak fluently, and can be taught to understand up to 2 languages.
15-20: It is able to speak fluently and understand all spoken languages it hears.

item.name: Companion Cookies
entries: These baked goods are mass produced by the mysterious Ladro Corp, and come in a wide variety of forms to accommodate nearly any companion's diet. As an action, you can feed a cookie to any companion you have a Bond Strength of 8 or higher with. For the next 8 hours, your companion gains 10 temporary hit points and has advantage on Constitution checks and saving throws. The first time you feed a companion this cookie, your Bond Strength increases by 1.

item.name: Crab Claw Gauntlets
entries: These spiked silver gauntlets resemble the claws of a giant crab.

While you are wearing these gauntlets, your unarmed strikes made with these claws deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier instead of their normal damage and gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike made with one of these claws, the creature is {@condition grappled} if the claw isn't already grappling another creature or holding an object.

item.name: Crest
entries: This {@item +1 dagger} belongs to {@creature Ramazith Flamesinger|BelzorMM}, and has the following additional magic properties:

items: As a bonus action, you can cause a green stone set into the dagger's pommel to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, or make the stone go dark.
Whenever you starts your turn underwater with 0 hit points, the dagger causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface.

item.name: Crystal Skull
entries: The skull can be used to cast the {@spell speak with dead} spell once per day.

item.name: Cursed Gold Coin
entries: This {@coinflip gold coin|Cursed Gold Coin|Skull|Crossbones} is minted with a skull on its 'head' and crossbones on its 'tail'. The gold coin is worth the same amount as a normal gold piece and could be melted down into gold bars or swapped for 'normal' gold pieces at a money changer.

entries.name: Curse
entries: The gold piece is cursed, a fact revealed only when an {@spell identify} spell is cast on the coin, or after the effects of the curse become apparent. Casting {@spell detect magic} reveals an aura of necromancy around the gold. Any creature that carries the gold for an hour or more is cursed. The curse can only be removed by {@spell remove curse} or similar magic, and does not end if the creature disposes of the gold.

While cursed, the creature's type becomes undead. In {@dice 1d4} days, the creature loses all appetite for food and drink and no longer needs them to survive. {@dice 1d4} days after that, the creature loses all need for air or sleep. {@dice 1d4} days after that, the creature's flesh begins to slough off its bones, leaving it a bare skeleton. This process takes {@dice 1d10} days and, while mildly painful and grotesque, has no effect on the creature's hit points. After the transformation is complete, the creature gains the following changes:

items: Their Dexterity score increases by 2.
Their Strength score decreases by 2.
Their Charisma score decreases by 4.
They gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage and immunity to poison damage.
They can't be {@condition poisoned}, or gain levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
They gain sense {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.
They are undead.

item.name: Cursed Ring of Shooting Stars
entries: While wearing this ring in dim light or darkness, you can cast {@spell dancing lights} and {@spell light} from the ring at will. Casting either spell from the ring requires an action.
The ring has 6 charges for the following other properties. The ring regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Faerie Fire
entries: You can expend 1 charge as an action to cast {@spell faerie fire} from the ring.

entries.name: Ball Lightning
entries: You can expend 2 charges as an action to create one to four 3-foot-diameter spheres of lightning. The more spheres you create, the less powerful each sphere is individually.

Each sphere appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of you. The spheres last as long as you concentrate (as if concentrating on a spell), up to 1 minute. Each sphere sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

As a bonus action, you can move each sphere up to 30 feet, but no farther than 120 feet away from you. When a creature other than you comes within 5 feet of a sphere, the sphere discharges lightning at that creature and disappears. That creature must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes lightning damage based on the number of spheres you created.

entries.name: Shooting Stars
entries: You can expend 1 to 3 charges as an action. For every charge you expend, you launch a glowing mote of light from the ring at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature within a 15-foot cube originating from that point is showered in sparks and must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Curse
entries: {@homebrew This ring is cursed, a fact that is revealed only when an {@spell identify} spell is cast on the ring or you attune to it. Attuning to ring curses you until you are targeted by the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic; removing the ring fails to end the curse. While cursed you have vulnerability to psychic damage.|Any creature attuned to this ring gains vulnerability to psychic damage.}

item.name: Delver's Armour
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armour. While wearing the armour underwater, you can speak {@homebrew its|it's} command word as an action to create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. This bubble stays with you until you speak the command word again, you doff the armour, or you are no longer underwater

item.name: Dragon Turtle Armor
entries: This fine turtle-shell armor constantly emits faint trails of steam. While wearing this armor, you gain a swim speed of 40 feet, have resistance to fire damage, and can breathe air and water.

While you are wearing the armor, you can use an action to cast {@spell burning hands} as a 3rd-level spell (save {@dc 15}) from the armor. When you cast the spell in this way, it produces a burst of steam instead of flames, and being underwater doesn't grant resistance against the spell's damage. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of your turns. On a 5 or 6, you regain the ability to cast the spell with this armor.

item.name: Dreadcutter
entries: Dreadcutter is a galleon that bristles with weaponry and flies a black pennant.

entries.name: Speed (per turn)
entries: 25 feet

entries.name: Weaponry
entries: Dreadcutter is equipped with two {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae}, a {@object mangonel}, and a {@object ram}, and can make one attack with each per turn. {@note Galleons have 5 weapon slots, so an additional weapon could be installed at the DM's discretion.}

items.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

items.name: Mangonel
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 feet of it), one target. {@h} 27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one object. {@h} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Dreadcutter is a sentient chaotic evil ship with an Intelligence of {@d20 3|16}, a Wisdom of {@d20 0|10}, and a Charisma of {@d20 4|18}. It has hearing out to a range of 120 feet.
The ship can speak and read {@language Common}, and communicate telepathically with any creature within 120 feet of it in a malicious, snarky tone.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Dreadcutter is arrogant and egotistic, desiring nothing more than to become the most feared pirate vessel on the Sword Coast. The ship was created when a drow wizard took her life aboard the galleon. Her soul lingers in the ship but retains no memory of her life.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: A character can attune to and interact with Dreadcutter as if it were a sentient weapon, though Dreadcutter attempts to take control of its wielder if it doesn't sink at least one ship per tenday.

item.name: Drow Slippers of Spider Climbing
entries: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.
This item loses its enchantment permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

item.name: Faericites
entries: Faericites are insect-like creatures that travel in pairs, and drain the vitality from their hosts. In return for this energy, they grant their host several benefits. They attach to the shoulders and lower back of humanoid creatures, and grant them the ability to fly using their massive wings. While wearing faericites, you gain the following features:

items: Your hit point maximum is reduced by 10.
If you are Large or smaller, you gain a flying speed of 40 ft

entries: In addition, the faericites have 3 charges, and any expended charges are regained after a long rest. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to instantly dash 60 ft. in any direction and make one attack.

item.name: Figgly's Wand of Squids
entries: This jet black wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell Figgly's exploding squid|BelzorMM} spell ({@hit 7} to hit) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand explodes in a burst of black ink and is destroyed.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Aquamarine Dolphin
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature dolphin|vgm|Aquamarine Dolphin}.
The aquamarine dolphin can become a {@creature dolphin|vgm} for up to 6 hours. While in dolphin form, the figurine allows you to cast the {@spell water breathing} spell at will.

item.name: Flow Gauntlets
entries: These gauntlets appear to be made out of mercury bound into a semi-solid shape, but become transparent when submerged in water. These gauntlets have 3 charges, and regain all expended charges daily at dawn. When you cast a spell that lacks the hydromancy tag while wearing these gauntlets, you can spend 1 charge to grant the spell the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet. When you cast a spell in this way, a watery hand appears at the chosen point, delivering the spell for you.

item.name: The Flying Squid
entries: The Flying Squid is a sailing ship powered by a {@creature water elemental} which is bound to a gyroscopic adamantine prison in the hold. Successfully binding the elemental requires a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check.

item.name: Fog Horn
entries: This silver horn 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell from it, producing a low drone audible out to 300 feet. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: Gauntlet of Aerial Command
entries: The gauntlet of aerial command is a large, leathery glove engraved with wing-like patterns. While wearing the gauntlet you gain a +1 bonus to AC. This gauntlet has 4 charges, and regains 1d4 expended charges at dawn.

As an action while attuned to the gauntlet, you can expend one charge to target one creature within 120 feet of you that has a flying speed. It must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by you for 1 minute. Until this effect ends, you can use a bonus action to designate a direction. The target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its next turn. It can take its action before it moves. After moving this way, it can make another Wisdom saving throw to try to end the effect.

item.name: Gold Fish
entries: This solid gold clockwork fish flops pathetically when it is within 120 feet of another piece of gold that is coin-sized or larger. If the fish is submerged, it instead swims toward the treasure at a rate of 10 feet per round.

item.name: Grail of Restoration
entries: This ornate alabaster grail can't be accidentally spilled. This grail has 20 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to drink from the grail or pour water from it on another creature's wounds, expending any number of charges from the grail. The target regains a number of hit points equal to the number of charges spent. Alternatively, you can expend 5 charges to cast {@spell lesser restoration}, or 20 charges to cast {@spell greater restoration} from the grail.
The grail regains all its charges by being refilled with water at a river or freshwater lake at the moment of dawn.

item.name: Gravity Rod
entries: Bearing a black stone on one end and white stone on the other, this bronze rod boasts the ability to manipulate gravity.
When you become attuned to the rod, you know how many levels of energy the rod has absorbed over the course of its existence, and how many levels of spell energy it currently has stored.
This rod has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell levitate} (save DC 15) or {@spell spider climb} spells from it.
The rod regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the rod's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: The item whispers warnings to its bearer, granting a +2 bonus to initiative if the bearer isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

item.name: Helm of Hunger
entries: This finned iron helmet resembles the visage of a shark, and grants the wearer the beast's signature frenzied hunger. While you are wearing the helmet you automatically know the location of each creature within 300 feet of you that doesn't have all of its hit points.

Additionally, this helmet has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While you are wearing the helmet, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell polymorph} spell targeting yourself. When you cast the spell in this way, you can only become a {@creature reef shark|MM}, {@creature hunter shark|MM}, {@creature giant shark|MM}, or {@creature megalodon|BelzorMM} obeying all of the spell's other rules.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This helmet is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. Removing the helmet fails to end the curse on you. While you are cursed, you require ten times as much food to sustain yourself each day.

item.name: Hydromancer's Trident
entries: This trident is carved with arcane channels that run its length, allowing it to transfer its movements through bodies of water. When you make an attack with this trident while you are standing within 5 feet of a body of water, you can choose a point within 30 feet of you that is within the same body of water. The attack is made as if you were at the chosen point, but you must use your own senses.

item.name: Instrument of the Coxswain
entries: This musical instrument has 7 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use an action to start a performance, expending 1 charge from it to command obedience from each creature of your choice that can see and hear you within 120 feet. The performance lasts for up to 1 minute, and ends if you use your action to do anything else. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw using your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} by you until the performance ends. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature uses its action to sing and all its movement to dance. You can mentally command the creature to instead use its action and movement to perform strenuous or intense labor such as mining, cleaning, crafting, or cooking and serving food and drinks.
