The creature can try to remove the gellump by taking an action to make a {@dc 11} Strength check, dropping it within 5 feet of them on a success.

A gellump is the smallest of oozes, little more than a sticky and corrosive glob. They can be found on deep cave walls, where they seem to bead up like condensation. Gellumps can move slowly, but seldom want to. In the wild they feed on insects that land on them, tricked by the gellump's natural transparency and slightly sweet odor.

Gellumps make good pets for those with low expectations. They can be held securely in an oiled container, or stuck on a piece of metal armor, and fed the occasional scrap of food. They sometimes make a bubbling sound while feeding, which is somewhat reminiscent of purring.

{@b {@i Sticky, Hungry.}}  The gellump's two main features make for an unpleasant combination. First, they adhere to any surface that isn't first rubbed down with oil. Second, they slowly dissolve any organic matter they come in contact with. It is generally advised to avoid direct contact with skin. Contact a cleric immediately if swallowed, and keep them away from children.

{@b {@i Aerodynamic.}}  One way that a gellump surpasses most other pets is as a projectile; in a pinch, throwing the acidic wad of goo in an enemy's face is a handy distraction. A gellump tends to stay in a dense, roughly cubicle form. When thrown, they reform into oval shaped discs, making them easy to throw far and accurately.

{@b {@i Combination.}}  Gellumps always face a scarcity of food, and prefer to stay tiny to preserve fuel. However, with an abundance of food, one can combine with other gellumps to form a larger ooze. Experiments have found that, with a massive offering of warm food, any number of gellumps that reach the area can form a single and gargantuan unit. If enough of them group together, they suddenly transform into a well-known cubic threat that haunts many dungeons. In retrospect, those experiments were a bad idea.

trait.name: Archerfish Hunting
entries: If the archerfish knocks a creature prone with its water shot attack, the archerfish can take a bonus action on its turn to make a bite attack against the target.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The archerfish has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The archerfish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Water Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature that is not submerged in water. {@h}If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from the archerfish and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The anglerfish has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Sand Camouflage
entries: The anglerfish has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The anglerfish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the anglerfish can't bite another target.

monster.name: Giant Seagull
languages: understands Common and Aquan but can't speak them

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The seagull makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The sea turtle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The squid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The squid makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its beak.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). A {@condition grappled} creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage at the start of each of the squid's turns.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the squid if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the squid can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The gilded heir is a 5th-level spellcaster. The gilded heir's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The gilded heir has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Quicken Spell (2/Day)
entries: The heir casts a spell it knows that has a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heir can make one golden longsword attack and one launch treasure attack.

action.name: Golden Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Launch Treasure
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage. This attack conjures a gilded object, which disappears after the attack is made.

reaction.name: All that Glitters (3/Day)
entries: When a creature targets the heir with an attack or harmful spell, the heir can force it to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition charmed} by the heir until the end of the heir's next turn, and must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. While the creature is {@condition charmed} in this way, it can't willingly move away from the heir.

monster.name: Gold Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hypnotic Pattern (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The golem creates a twisting pattern of colors inside a 30-foot cube originating from it, which appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature inside the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} by this effect, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0. The effect ends for a creature if it takes any damage, or if someone else uses an action to shake it out of its stupor.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Common

trait.name: Environment
entries: Desert, Urban

trait.name: Diet
entries: Insects, Meat, Sunlight

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Hard

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Proud, Quiet

action.name: Spiney Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

Echine cactal folk believe the scarce resources of the desert should belong to its conquerors. Bands of Echine warriors constantly seek to drive off rivals and claim new territory. They mark the shifting boundaries of their lands with sun-bleached animal bones, the only warning they will give of the fate meted out to trespassers.

Anyone hoping to pass safely through Echine territory must bring tribute that the Echine value more than the water in their bodies. Nearly as much as water, they crave new weapons, with which to conquer their enemies the Opunti. A tried and true warrior may attract the companionship of an echine tribesman, who will venture alongside them in hopes of finding new land to conquer.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The GonBun's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Very Rare

trait.name: Diet
entries: Blood, Negative Emotions

trait.name: Environment
entries: Ruins, Space, Underwater

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Easy (only bonds with Evil aligned creatures)

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Cruel, Quiet

action.name: Spit Fire {@recharge 4}
entries: Bun spits a wave of flames that cover a 15 foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d8 - 1}) piercing damage.

The nightmarish GonBun is a single mind animating two distinct bodies. GonBun appears so rarely that sages are not sure whether it is one entity appearing every few centuries, or if multiple GonBuns have visited our world over the ages. GonBun makes its lair among ruins in the deepest reaches of the ocean, creating a dead space where the water boils and putrefies around them. It waits here for the emergence of a powerful wizard in the world above. When it senses such a wizard, GonBun seeks them out wherever they may be, in order to guide them down a dark path.

entries.name: Gon
entries: The Gon body has the shape of a skeletal snake with an alligator-like skull, animated by lurid red tendons that cling to the bones. Inside the Gon is a necrotic void, and absolute absence of life, which gives it limited magical power and control over undeath.

entries.name: Bun
entries: The Bun body, on the other hand, is amorphous and leech-like, covered by an unnerving abundance of eyes. In the Bun's gut burns an insatiable, destructive fire that glows and radiates shimmering heat whenever Bun opens its mouth.

entries.name: Sinister Tutors
entries: The GonBun is a servant of gods who govern evil, magic, and necromancy. When it emerges from its deep slumber, it seeks out powerful mages who have begun to search for the secret of immortality. GonBun tests the mage, beginning with a series of questions to measure the prospect's arcane knowledge, and finally attacking to measure the mage's intuition. If GonBun deems the mage worthy, it guides them on the path towards transforming oneself into a lich.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Grabbit wears a {@item helm of comprehending languages} that looks like a towering crown of twisted driftwood, allowing her to communicate with the crew.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goblin makes two attacks with its whip.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature the goblin can see targets it with an attack, the goblin chooses another goblin within 5 feet of it. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.
{@homebrew At the DM's discretion, this reaction can also be used to swap places with any of Grabbit's crew within 5 feet.}

Despite her stature, Grabbit holds great sway on the ship. Most of the crew aboard are monstrous and respond better to her orders than those from the pirate lords or Tentrix himself. Her command over the crew comes from her ruthlessness; she has a deadly habit of kicking crew who question her authority off the plank (see {@adventure area t1|BelzorMM|T1. Top Deck|0}) down to the zombie tank ({@adventure area t12|BelzorMM|T12. Hold|0}) where they're torn apart by the undead ogre within.
Grabbit uses the statistics of a {@creature goblin boss} with the following changes:

items: Grabbit wears a {@item helm of comprehending languages} that looks like a towering crown of twisted driftwood, allowing her to communicate with the crew.
She wields a {@item whip|phb} instead of a {@item scimitar|phb}, and can multiattack without disadvantage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea lion can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The sea lion has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The sea lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sea lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Swimming Leap
entries: With a 10-foot swimming start, the sea lion can long jump out of or across the water up to 25 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the graven image remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statuette.

trait.name: Foment Madness
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the graven image must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or it hears a faint buzzing in hits head for a moment and then has disadvantage on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

If the saving throw against Foment Madness fails by 5 or more, the creature is instead subjected to the {@spell confusion} spell for 1 minute (no concentration required by the graven image). While under the effect of that {@spell confusion}, the creature is immune to Foment Madness.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The graven image is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The graven image has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The graven image's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eye of the deep makes two demoralising beam attacks.

action.name: Demoralising Beam
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) force damage. If the target is a humanoid, its Charisma score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this reduces its Charisma to 0.

action.name: Gaseous Curse {@recharge 5}
entries: The graven image targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or become cursed. While cursed, the target transforms, along with everything it is wearing or carrying, into a misty cloud.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strenth, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.
The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

Some of the darkest cults in the world have devised a way to sculpt idols in the image of Elder Evils and Far Realm deities. These idols, if fashioned correctly, can act as conduits for these beings on the Material Plane. A graven idol is typically made of semi-precious stone such as jet or jade and has hideous abilities that are terrifying to witness.

entries.name: Ritual Made
entries: Each graven image must be fashioned over a period of months by one who has seen into the beyond, and gained the knowledge of the form of an Elder Evil or similar entity. The holder of this knowledge must then sculpt the form from precious material, and birth it into the world in a ritual which typically requires human sacrifice.

entries.name: Otherworldly Powers
entries: A graven image has several unique abilities that make it terrifying to encounter. Their very nature is madness-inducing, causing even the staunchest warriors to fumble and lose their way. They can teleport through the material plane at will, disappearing from one space and reappearing in another as easily as walking across a room. They can fire beams of energy that sap a creature's will and even humanity, or curse a creature to exist in an entirely other form, akin to a cloud of vapour.

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries: A graven image doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the worm dies, it explodes in a blast of electrified gore. Each creature within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the worm is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The worm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes two bite attacks, or uses its Flare and makes a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns. If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Flare
entries: The worm releases a brilliant flash of light. Each creature within 60 feet of the worm that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be blinded and stunned for 1 minute. Creature with darkvision have disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature can repeat the saving throw each time it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once a creature successfully saves against this effect, or if this effect ends for it, that creature is immune to the Flare of all mottled worms for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Uncommon

trait.name: Environment
entries: Desert, Grasslands, Ruins, Urban

trait.name: Diet
entries: Fruit, Meat

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Hard

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Brave, Proud

trait.name: Scavenging
entries: The grimalkinn can find food and fresh water for itself each day, provided that the land offers berries, small game, water, and so forth.

trait.name: Natural Language
entries: Through simple sounds, expression, and posture the grimalkinn can communicate simple ideas with small or smaller beasts.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

These small, feline humanoids live in secretive clans, often hiding on the edges of other civilizations. The grimalkinns that outsiders are most likely to encounter are either warriors watching the perimeter of a settlement, or outcasts making their own way in the world.

{@b {@i Resourceful Scavengers.}}  Grimalkinn make ingenious use of what other civilizations cast off. They re-forge scrap metal into tools and weapons, and sew discarded rags into exquisite clothing. They are especially creative when it comes to food, hunting creatures that other cultures consider vermin and cooking foods others consider spoiled. Grimalkinn who leave their clans often find employment as cooks on dangerous expeditions, using their native culinary skills to conjure delicious meals out of unlikely ingredients.

{@b {@i Beast Talk.}}  Grimalkinn share a talent for communicating with other creatures. The Grimalkinn language that they use among themselves consists not only of sounds, but of posture, scent, and significant silences. They have created a pidgin form of this language that allows them to communicate with most animals on their own terms, holding complex conversations that would normally require magic.

{@b {@i Honor-Bound.}}  Grimalkinn society places great importance in personal honor. A grimalkinn builds his or her honor by serving the clan well, and by honoring promises. Grimalkinn who go back on their word or abandon their duty find themselves cast out from their clan and forced to seek a living among the other races. Such outcasts often find companionship, and a familiar focus on honor, in the military structure of mercenary bands, where they make themselves indispensable in and out of battle.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Rare

trait.name: Environment
entries: Ruins, Underground, Urban

trait.name: Diet
entries: Organic Material

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Average

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Greedy, Hardy

action.name: Merge
entries: The gummybear ooze chooses one other gummybear ooze within 5 feet of itself. They then merge together, combining their hit points and growing by one size category. If this action is taken four times without splitting, the group becomes an amalgamation.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a gummybear ooze is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two segments if it has at least 4 hit points. Each new segment has hit points equal to half the original gummybear ooze's, rounded down. New segments are one size smaller than the original gummybear ooze.

A gooey, cute, yet macabre form shambles across the cave floor, accompanied by a strangely sweet, almost fruity odor. Gummybear oozes have a more coherent shape than most other oozes, maintaining an oddly ursine form as they lurch and jiggle. Bards have long suggested that the same mad mage responsible for owlbears also created these abominations, perhaps while distracted by hunger.

Like other oozes, a gummybear ooze feeds by enveloping and slowly consuming its prey. The process is slower with these oozes than with others, making them safe to touch for a short time. Nevertheless, although it looks like an approaching gummybear ooze wants a hug, prolonged snuggling can cause skin irritation, emulsification, and eventually death.

{@b {@i Mixed-and-Matched.}}  Parts of the ooze that are severed maintain their shape: a "head" remains a head and an "arm" remains an arm, although the ooze is not deterred by losing these parts. Such severed appendages readily reattach to their owner, or to any other gummybear ooze they come in contact with. Those who keep gummybear oozes around, for whatever reason, sometimes take advantage of this quality by switching the heads or limbs of different specimens, creating a "customized" ooze to follow them on adventures.

{@b {@i Melding.}}  Gummybear oozes grow by combining with other gummybear oozes, either absorbing their severed parts or merging with them entirely. Though most gummybear oozes are about 2 feet high, they can aggregate to a truly terrifying scale. Although merging gummybear oozes slowly redistribute themselves into a single bear-shape, a newly-merged ooze can retain features from its smaller members, such as multiple heads or a proliferation of arms.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Very Rare

trait.name: Environment
entries: Ruins, Underground, Urban

trait.name: Diet
entries: Organic Material

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Hard

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Aggressive, Hardy

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lob Gummybear {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit -1} to hit, range 10/20 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage, and a gummybear segment appears within 5 feet of the target.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a gummybear ooze amalgamation is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two segments if it has at least 20 hit points. Each new segment has hit points equal to half the original amalgamation's, rounded down. New segments are medium-sized. If the amalgamation is reduced to less than 20 hit points, it instead becomes a gummybear ooze.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Rare

trait.name: Environment
entries: Ruins, Underground, Urban

trait.name: Diet
entries: Organic Material

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Average

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Greedy

action.name: Repair
entries: The segment can use its action to grab another segment within 5 feet of itself and become a gummybear ooze again. This action does not restore its hit points.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Rare

trait.name: Environment
entries: Ruins, Urban

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Average

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Cruel, Quiet

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The hand axe is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Skittering Retreat
entries: If the hand axe makes a successful melee attack against a creature (whether in axe form or hand form), that creature can't make opportunity attacks against it for the rest of the hand axe's turn.

trait.name: Form Change
entries: The hand axe can use a bonus action to change to an immobile axe form, or back into its true form, which resembles a modified crawling claw. While in its axe form, it has a speed of 0 and can be wielded as a +1 handaxe.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Scratch (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

There are scarcely beings more dangerous than a lich with ample free time and a passionate disdain for loot-hungry adventurers. In order to spite these greedy deviants, these dark mages graft tantalizing magical weapons onto hideous severed hands. These modified claws remain motionless until they feel vibrations draw close. A clueless grave-robber could easily lose their hand to a cleverly disguised hand axe, providing yet more fuel to craft even more of these insidious beasts.

{@b {@i Malicious Multi-Tool.}}  In combat, these claws can serve a dual purpose. They enhance the arsenal of the necromancer's horde while waiting in the wings. Floods of undead welding a variety of magical weaponry storm into battle, but alas may fall to the persistent heroes. When such eager explorers go to claim their prizes, the weapons, drawn to their heartbeats, spring to life to greet the victors with a hungry blade.

{@b {@i Dearly Domesticated.}}  Separating the hand from its mystical weapon is messy work, and clever delvers can make better use of their time trying to tame this undead urchin. If an adventurer produces a convincing facsimile of the hand's master, it can go a long way toward forging a gloriously gruesome friendship. Like your typical domestic pet, the hand axe will always return to its master and protect them to the bitter end. Best of all, it already knows how to play dead.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Common

trait.name: Environment
entries: Desert, Forest, Grasslands, Mountain

trait.name: Diet
entries: Fish, Rodents

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Average

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Brave, Quiet

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Aerial Charge
entries: If the hawk flies at least 40 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a talon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

Larger than falcons, hawks build broad nests in tall trees, hunting in forests and over adjacent plains. Hawks are famous for their agility in flight, even among other raptors. They use their long tails to make precise maneuvers that few other birds can match. When they spot prey, they can dive with incredible speed.
Hawks are especially merciless predators, snatching up smaller birds and any other small creatures who let their guards down. Once a hawk has chosen a victim, that creature almost never escapes.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries: "The eyes of a hawk" is a well-worn phrase, but hawks' ears are equally sharp.They can find their prey by sound even if it is well camouflaged in dense foliage. Hawks have versatile voices to match their well-developed sense of hearing.They use a wide range of calls to claim territory and communicate with each other.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hippocamp can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Warhorse Armor
entries: An armored warhorse has an AC based on the type of barding worn (see the {@i Player's Handbook} for more information on barding). The horse's AC includes its Dexterity modifier, where applicable. Barding doesn't alter the horse's challenge rating.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Hoch Miraz wears a {@item ring of swimming} and a {@item ring of spell turning}. While wearing the latter, Hoch Miraz has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only him (not in an area of effect). In addition, if Hoch Miraz rolls a 20 for the save and the spell is 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on him and instead targets the caster, using the slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Hoch Miraz regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If Hoch Miraz takes fire or radiant daamge, this trait doesn't function at the start of Hoch Miraz's next turn. Hoch Miraz's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When Hoch Miraz's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a {@spell wish} spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Hoch Miraz is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: Hoch Miraz knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which he seeks revenge, even if the creature and Hoch Miraz are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by Hoch Miraz dies, Hock Miraz knows.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hoch Miraz is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Hoch Miraz has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hoch Miraz makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which Hoch Miraz has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning daamge. Instead of dealing damage, Hoch Miraz can grapple the target (escape {@dc 11}) provided the target is Large or smaller.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
entries: Hoch Miraz targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until Hoch Miraz deals damage to it, or until the end of Hoch Miraz's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is {@condition frightened} of Hoch Miraz for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see Hoch Miraz, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

Hoch Miraz was a Calishite wizard looking to make his fortune in the mining industry on the island of Gundarlun. In around 1330 DR (more than a century and a half ago), Hoch Miraz was aboard the Golden Crown, a treasure vessel headed back from the mines of Berranzo, when a vicious storm struck the coast and sunk the ship.

Since the sahuagin have taken up host in the shipwreck, Hoch has been stirring in his watery grave. The mage is close to an undead reanimation, and he won't be happy to discover his {@item staff of the magi} missing.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: Hoch Miraz doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Being dead doesn't mean anything, once I have my staff back I'll work something out."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My {@item staff of the magi} must be returned to me, without it I can't hope to rebuild my reputation."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "Once I decide on a plan of action, I cannot be swayed from it."

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Very Rare

trait.name: Environment
entries: Ruins, Space, Underground, Urban

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Hard

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Chatty, Clever

trait.name: Perfect Memory
entries: The holo can perfectly recall anything it has seen or heard since its creation, and it perfectly remembers everything its "original" knew at the moment of its creation.

trait.name: Voice Command
entries: When asked by name, the holo can provide one piece of information from the following list:

items: The current weather and forecast for the rest of the day.
The number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
One previously mentioned piece of information that the holo was asked to remember.

action.name: Shock Surge
entries: The holo creates an electric surge to attack one target that it is touching. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 1 lightning damage.

action.name: Necrotic Projection
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

These undying souls are able to manifest as projected light, technology shaped by long-forgotten magic. They preserve the intelligence, knowledge, and personality of a long-dead humanoid in a form of immortality. Though they exist in a disembodied form, they continue to think, learn, and even speak to others as if they were still alive.
Holos tend to be highly intelligent and very talkative, perhaps owing to how long they have spent lost in ancient ruins with no one to talk to.

{@b {@i Info Discs.}}  The device a holo "lives" inside appears to be a small, thick disc that can fit in the palm of a hand. This metallic wonder can project the being in a hologram ranging from minuscule to medium sizes, and can scan the area around the holo. The disc also appears to amplify their cognitive and memorizing ability. In addition to containing what appears to be a soul, it can also provide useful information beyond what a normal person would know.

{@b {@i  Ancient Minds.}}  A holo is a trove of knowledge from ancient times, with first-hand memories of events that historians may be only dimly aware of. Their memories are perfect with regard to their experiences after their creation. They can also offer surprising insights, having had more time to think than any mortal being. However, with centuries to think, most of them in isolation, holos tend to have a few ideas that would strike most mortals as insane.

{@b {@i Existential Questions.}}  Because holos are so ancient and rare, sages have not had the chance to study them and many questions remain about their nature. Chief among these is whether they contain the soul of the being whose personality they contain, or if they are only a duplicate. If the "original" soul passed on to the outer planes, does the holo contain a soul of its own, or is it merely a construct? The holos, at least, consider themselves the same entity as the original being. This certainly was the hope of those who made the holos in their image originally.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The holy water minister is a 5th-level spellcaster. The holy water minister's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The holy water minister has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Divine Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 10 feet toward the minister. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes an extra 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

action.name: Holy Water Ministration (3/Day)
entries: The minister anoints a willing creature within 5 feet of it with water. The target regains 3 (1d6) hit points and is cured of one disease or poison affecting it.

action.name: Water Ward (1/Day)
entries: The minister douses up to six creatures within 20 feet of it with blessed water. Each target gains 10 temporary hit points, which last for 1 hour. While a creature has these hit points, it can walk on the surface of water as if it were harmless solid ground, has resistance to acid and fire damage, and gains a +1 bonus to AC.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The hooded nebula's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Solar Sail
entries: Whenever the hooded nebula is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead can immediately move up to half its speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hooded nebula makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the hooded nebula jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the hooded nebula's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the hooded nebula's space.

action.name: Gleam (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The hooded nebula fans open its hood, releasing a blast of light in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

A star elemental is a glowing mass of starlight with a vague semblance of a face. They are a strange variant of their fire elemental kin, channeling their energy as light and heat. As they are constructed of luminous plasma, direct contact with a star elemental can be dangerous.

entries.name: Denizens of Space
entries: Rather than occupying any of the elemental planes, star elementals can be found deep in space or adrift in the astral plane.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: Like their other elemental kin, a star elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Sun-Sailing Lizards
entries: Traveling the depths of space are the hooded nebula, elemental lizards bearing magnificent neck frills that store and release sunlight.
Hooded nebula are innately curious creatures, and travel from world to world in to satisfy their thirst for knowledge.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hoondarrh's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hoondarrh is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20} {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Hoondarrh has a magical emerald called Ongild (which functions as a {@item ring of regeneration} and gives him the Innate Spellcasting feature) embedded in his scaly hide, he carries a {@item rod of lordly might}, and wears a {@item ring of feather falling}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Hrug can move up to his movement speed toward a hostile creature he can see or hear. He must end this move closer to the enemy than he started.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: Hrug counts as one size larger when determining his carrying capacity and the weight he can push, drag, or lift.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Rarity
entries: Uncommon

trait.name: Environment
entries: Forest, Lake, Mountain, River, Swamp, Underground, Underwater

trait.name: Diet
entries: Meat

trait.name: Taming Difficulty
entries: Very Hard

trait.name: Suggested Personality
entries: Grumpy, Hardy

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra puck can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra puck has two heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.Whenever the hydra takes 2 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn. The hydra puck regains 1 hit point for each head regrown in this way. The hydra puck can have up to 6 heads.A hydra puck cannot sustain more than its original pair of heads, and sheds any excess heads it has grown during a long rest.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra puck sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra puck makes as many attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

The hydra puck is a strange creature, spawned from the blood of an ancient hydra who is said to have grown too large for the world. Slain by a nameless hero, its countless heads fell to the ground, and out of each severed throat crawled a diminutive beast who shared its creator's hateful hunger.

entries.name: Solitary Hunters
entries: Hydra pucks make their homes near ponds, grottos, and wide rivers. Here, they prowl for any ounce of meat they can cram into one of their several maws. Far from social, these creatures will fight to the death against anything that would intrude on their territory. Aside from their preferred isolation, adventurers have noted similarities between hydra pucks and angry geese.

entries.name: Bickering Heads
entries: As dragons who loathe company, their ironic nature leads to unique interactions when hydra pucks grow one too many heads. More heads may mean greater strength, and the few who enjoy having all six heads are remarkably deadly. However, hydra pucks are known to fight with themselves and occasionally rip off their own heads for food.

trait.name: Aqueous Transportation (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the hydromancer can teleport to an unoccupied location it can see within 30 feet of it, provided that both the space it is teleporting from and its destination are in or at least touching water.

trait.name: Create Pool
entries: When the hydromancer casts a spell of 1st level or higher, it creates a 10-foot-radius pool of water centered on a point it can see within 30 feet of it, which lasts for 1 minute, and stays in its location, even on inclines or if subjected to strong winds. If the hydromancer starts its turn within a pool, its speed increases by 10 feet until the end of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hydromancer is a 5th-level spellcaster. The hydromancer's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The hydromancer has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Ice Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Cold Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Water Walking
entries: The golem can move across the surface of liquid water as if it were harmless solid ground, and rises at a rate of 60 feet per round if submerged.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the golem's next turn.

action.name: Sleep Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The golem exhales sleep gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

trait.name: Injured
entries: The githyanki initially has 30 hit points remaining.

trait.name: Stolen Body
entries: The githyanki's brain has been replaced by an {@creature intellect devourer}, which controls the githyanki and has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the githyanki. The intellect devourer knows everything its host knew.

If the host body dies, the intellect devourer must leave it. A {@spell protection from evil and good} spell cast on the body drives the intellect devourer out. The intellect devourer is also forced out if the githyanki regains its devoured brain by means of a {@spell wish}. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the intellect devourer can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies, unless its brain is restored within 1 round.

trait.name: Detect Sentience
entries: The intellect devourer inside the githyanki can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githyanki's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Silver Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. This is a magic weapon attack. On a critical hit against a target in an astral body (as with the {@spell astral projection} spell), the githyanki can cut the silvery cord that tethers the target to its material body, instead of dealing damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The harpy doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The harpy can make three claw attacks or two shortbow attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Luring Song
entries: The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the harpy, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the harpy, the target must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Jarl Bluebeard wields a {@item tentacle rod} and wears a {@item ring of swimming}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jarl Bluebeard makes two battleaxe attacks.

action.name: Tentacle Rod
entries: Each of the three tentacles on the rod attacks a creature: {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., up to three targets. {@h} 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage. If Jarl Bluebeard hits a target with all three tentacles, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions for 1 minute. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Beard {@recharge 5}
entries: The jarl swings his beard before him in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

Chief defender of Driftwood Docks, Jarl Bluebeard is a frost giant from Svardborg who joined the Black Armada after Jarl Storvald was killed by an adventuring party and the Ordning was restored. Looking for a way to please his god, Thrym, the raiding lifestyle promised by Tentrix to the giants caught his eye. Bluebeard's fanatical devotion to pleasing Thrym is not his only mark of insanity. The giant also insists on eating nothing but raw shark meat, weaving hammers into his beard, and hurling rocks at any ship not flying the flag of the Black Armada.

Despite serving the Sea King, Bluebeard knows little about Tentrix's true allegiances. He respects Tentrix simply because he upholds a life that Thrym would approve of; something not common in the small-folk. He knows that Tentrix is from Purple Rocks and that he has magical control over the ocean, but nothing more.

As the name suggests, Jarl Bluebeard has a bright, ice-blue beard into which he has braided half a dozen warhammers. Not used to the warmer climate of the Nelanthers, the Jarl tends to shun shirts, leaving his torso bare, save a few skulls from prized kills. The Jarl's nose is broken beyond repair and he has several giant runes tattooed across his forehead

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Thrym is the father of frost giants, I will prove myself worthy to be called his son."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My alliance with Sea King Tentrix gives me the opportunity to raid and fight without him, I would be stuck in Svardborg."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "People sometimes call me insane. I kill them so the rumour doesn't spread."

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Jasper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: Jasper can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than his.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When Jasper rolls a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: Jasper can attempt to {@action hide} even when he is only obscured by a creature that is at least one size larger than him.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Jasper wields a {@item staff of thunder and lightning}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adept makes three unarmed strikes or three dart attacks. Alternatively, Jasper can make two staff attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the adept can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the adept's next turn.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Jhamis' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). Jhamis can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Jhimas can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: Jhimas can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of his words, though he has no special ability to understand them in return.

trait.name: Guardian of the Depths
entries: Jhamis is acclimated to an underwater environment.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Crushing Movement
entries: The first time the kalantropis moves into a space occupied by a creature or object on a turn, it can attempt to ram into it. A target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creature or object is then pushed out of the kalantropis' space.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the kalantropis remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a pile of bones.

trait.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: The kalantropis can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 30 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the kalantropis, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 18} Strength check against it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the kalantropis fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever the kalantropis is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Necrotic Vents
entries: When the kalantropis regains hit points from its Necrotic Absorption, glowing purple vents form along its body, causing it to shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius until the start of its next turn. At the start of its next turn, the kalantropis expels necrotic energy from these vents. Each non-undead creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the kalantropis is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 year unless it is prevented from doing so by a wish spell.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The kalantropis deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The kalantropis has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kalantropis makes three attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 50 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the kalantropis can't use the same tendril on another target.

action.name: Reel
entries: The kalantropis pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Murky Discharge (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The kalantropis spits forth black sludge in a 60-foot cone. Each non-undead creature in the area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The sludge remains in the area until the start of the kalantropis's next turn if it is underwater, lightly obscuring the area. Each undead creature within the sludge has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws it makes, and its weapon attacks deal an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Tendril Attack
entries: The kalantropis makes a tendril attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The kalantropis moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Fester (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the kalantropis must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and its maximum hit points are not reduced.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Karkos can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: Karkos can't swim, and sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater, and is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
entries: As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, Karkos can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, which Karkos ignores. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken.

If used while underwater, the shock wave also propagates through the water in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on Karkos. Each creature within the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Karkos and knocked {@condition prone}.

The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is {@condition restrained}, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become trapped.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Karkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Karkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Karkos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Karkos deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Karkos makes two grasping claw attacks and uses its Claw Slam twice, targeting two different areas that are at least 60 feet apart. It can use its Fling in place of any of its grasping claw attacks.

action.name: Grasping Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Karkos can automatically hit the target with its grasping claw.

action.name: Claw Slam
entries: Karkos slams one of its massive claws down, targeting a 30-foot-cube within 120 feet of it. The area must be at least 30 feet away from Karkos. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 51 ({@damage 8d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.

action.name: Fling
entries: Karkos throws a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling, or a Huge or smaller object it is holding. The target is hurled up to 120 feet horizontally in a direction of Karkos' choice. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or land {@condition prone} and take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tsunami (Recharge 5–6)
entries: Karkos disturbs the surface of a body of water, creating a massive wave that functions as per the tsunami spell (save {@dc 24}) appearing in a space adjacent to Karkos. The wave produced by this effect is not magical, and Karkos doesn't need to maintain concentration on it.

reaction.name: Catching
entries: If a Huge or smaller object is hurled at Karkos, it can catch the missile and take no damage from it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Karkos makes a grasping claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Karkos moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Claw Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Karkos uses its Claw Slam.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Karkos can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: Karkos can't swim, and sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater, and is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
entries: As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, Karkos can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, which Karkos ignores. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken.

If used while underwater, the shock wave also propagates through the water in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on Karkos. Each creature within the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Karkos and knocked {@condition prone}.

The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is {@condition restrained}, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become trapped.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Karkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Karkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Karkos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Karkos deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

trait.name: Grim Fortitude
entries: Karkos is immune to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Stench of Death
entries: Karkos reeks of corruption and foul magic. Each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Karkos must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage and be poisoned until the start of its next turn. Additionally, creatures within 30 feet of Karkos regain half as many hit points from any healing. If Karkos is fully submerged in holy water, it permanently loses this trait, along with its Grim Fortitude trait and Maddening Miasma legendary action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Karkos makes two grasping claw attacks and uses its Claw Slam twice, targeting two different areas that are at least 60 feet apart. It can use its Fling in place of any of its grasping claw attacks.

Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Karkos can automatically hit the target with its grasping claw.

On a successful save, the creature takes no damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or land {@condition prone} and take 3 {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: Karkos disturbs the surface of a body of water, creating a massive wave that functions as per the tsunami spell (save {@dc 24}) appearing in a space adjacent to Karkos. The wave produced by this effect is not magical, and Karkos doesn't need to maintain concentration on it.

reaction.name: Catching
entries: If a Huge or smaller object is hurled at Karkos, it can catch the missile and take no damage from it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Karkos makes a grasping claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Karkos moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Claw Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Karkos uses its Claw Slam.

legendary.name: Maddening Miasma (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Karkos releases a wave of twisted miasma. Each creature within 120 feet of Karkos must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by Karkos. The {@condition charmed} target regards Karkos as its sole master, and protects it at any cost. While charmed, a creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1, and it is unable to cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition charmed} creature can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the effect ends on the target. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Karkos' Maddening Corruption for the next 24 hours.

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become trapped.

entries: If Karkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Karkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Karkos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Karkos deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

trait.name: Psionic Barrier
entries: Karkos and each creature within 120 feet of it has full cover from effects that originate more than 120 feet away from it, and has resistance to all damage.

trait.name: Protection Stones
entries: Karkos is surrounded by six Large psionic lodestones, which float at a distance of 30 feet away from Karkos. Each stone is an object with AC 20, 100 hit points, immunity to psychic and poison damage, and resistance to all other damage. For each stone around it, Karkos gains a +1 bonus to its AC and saving throws, and gains 50 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns. If all six stones are destroyed, Karkos loses its Psionic Barrier trait and Psychic Pulse legendary action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Karkos makes two grasping claw attacks and uses its Claw Slam twice, targeting two different areas that are at least 60 feet apart. It can use its Fling in place of any of its grasping claw attacks.

Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Karkos can automatically hit the target with its grasping claw.

On a successful save, the creature takes no damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.
