entries: Your understanding of the nature of souls unlocks its secrets for you. You learn the following spells at the following levels. These are occultist spells for you.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Light
entries: Your understanding of light illuminates the world in new ways. You learn the following spells at the following levels. These are occultist spells for you.

optionalfeature.name: Mystery of Darkness
entries: Your understanding of darkness unlocks the secrets shrouded from others. You learn the following spells at the following levels. These are occultist spells for you.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Rites
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies}. During a long rest, you can use them to concoct an improvised {@item potion of healing} spending 1 hour of the long rest to tend to it's simmering. Due to it's improvised nature, it expires in 24 hours, and has no value in gold pieces.

During this process, you can expend a 5th level spell to make it a {@item potion of greater healing|DMG|greater healing potion}. The expended spell slot is regained when the long rest is completed as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Corrupt Item
entries: You use a dark and secret rite to corrupt a non-magical item causing it to become a cursed magic item. While any creature other than you is in possession of this item, they are under the effect of {@spell bane}. Select one of the following for the items magical property (the item must be of a type of item that could be the magical item selected): {@item bag of tricks}, {@item brooch of shielding}, {@item goggles of night}, {@item lantern of revealing}, or {@item staff of the python} (you can ignore attunement restrictions of this item).
When you change rites, you can reselect this rite to destroy the item and create a new item.

optionalfeature.name: Commune Beyond Death
entries: You learn the {@spell speak with dead} spell, and it's an Occultist spell for you, but does not count against your spells known. You can cast it without expending a spell slot. Once you cast it this way, you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it this way again.

optionalfeature.name: Emblazoned Focus
entries: You emblazon a mystical mark on yourself, via a tattoo, scar, or similar permanent mark. You can use this as your spell casting focus for casting spells. You no longer need a free hand to cast spells with somatic or material components, as you can channel your magic through this mark though it glows visible when you do so. To work in this manner, the mark must remain uncovered (casting in this way does not remove the signs of casting a spell, merely means you do not need a free hand).

optionalfeature.name: Expert of Tradition
entries: Choose a skill you are proficient in from among {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, and {@skill Survival}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency. If you do not have proficiency in any of the selected skills, you instead gain proficiency in one of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Forbidden Rites
entries: You learn the spell {@spell animate dead}. It is an Occultist spell for you and does not count against the number of Occultist spells you know. This spell cannot gain the ritual tag with {@optfeature Lost Ritual|BelzorMM}.

optionalfeature.name: Lost Ritual
entries: You learn of a ritual lost to time. Select an Occultist spell you know of 5th level or lower. This spell gains the ritual tag. You can cast this spell as a ritual once, and must complete a short or long rest before casting it as a ritual again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you cast the selected spell

optionalfeature.name: Markings of Protections
entries: You mark yourself with magical symbols and patterns, protecting you from harm. You are under the effect of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Occult Magic
entries: Your Occultist spells known increases by one. You can select this rite multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Protective Ward
entries: You make a ward against supernatural harm. While wearing this charm, you can use this to cast {@spell protection from evil and good} without expending a spell slot, components, or requiring concentration, but the spell lasts a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier. You can cast this as a reaction to being attacked or making a save it would benefit you from, but when you do so it only lasts until the start of your next turn instead.
Once you use this charm, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Immortality
entries: You continue to age, but you will no longer die of old age.

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Youth
entries: You cease to visually age, and can even choose to become more youthful in appearance, though your lifespan remains the natural lifespan of your race.

optionalfeature.name: Root of Magic
entries: You learn 10 {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0} from any class list of your choice. They are Occultist spells for you.

optionalfeature.name: Spatial Storage
entries: You can convert a pocket, ring, hat, or bag into a spatial storage device, capable of carrying up 5 x your Occultist level lbs, with 0.5 cubic foot of storage space x your Occultist level. So, for example, a level 5 Occultist can store things that would fit in a 2.5 cubic area weighing up to 25 lbs in the storage. As an action, you can send an item you are holding into the storage or retrieve an item from storage to your hand.
If lost, you can recreate the spatial storage device during a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Specialized Poisons
entries: When you deal poison damage with an Occultist spell or created poison, you can (but don't have to) specify a creature type (such as beast or monstrosity) it is created to affect. Damage from that spell or poison ignores resistance and immunity to poison damage by creatures of that type. Creatures without the selected creature type have resistance to poison damage from the spell effect or poison.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Sense
entries: You gain the ability to gaze into the spiritual world around you. As an action, you can gain a special form of sight that lasts 1 minute. While under the effect of this special sight, you are {@condition blinded|PHB|blind} beyond 30 feet, but within 30 feet you can see into the ethereal plane. Within this sight range you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws to detect and see through illusions, see invisible creatures, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or transformed creature.

optionalfeature.name: Soulburn
entries: You can make your powers sear the very soul of the creature they strike. When you deal cold, fire or lightning damage, you can choose to make it deal necrotic damage instead.

entries.name: The Way I Learned To Soulburn
entries: Note that you can use Soulburn in conjunction with the elemental conversion of The Way I Learned It to convert spells to Necrotic.

optionalfeature.name: Sympathetic Bond
entries: You learn the {@spell warding bond} spell. It is an Occultist spell for you, but does not count against your spells known.

When you cast warding bond you can choose to increase the power of the bond. When you do so, if either bonded creature makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, both creatures make the save. If either passes, both pass the save, but if both fail, both are affected by the condition being saved against, even if only one was targeted. If both creatures are saving against the same effect, they do not roll twice, but both pass if either passes their saving throws, and both fail if both fail their saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Vestments of War
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter medium armor|items|source=PHB|type=medium armor}.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item shield|PHB|shields}.

optionalfeature.name: Hedge Magic
entries: {@i (You can take this Rite multiple times)}
You learn an additional cantrip from the Occultist list or from the expanded list provided by the Practical Skills feature.

optionalfeature.name: I Know That One!
entries: When you make a saving throw against a spell you know, or make a spellcasting ability check to use {@spell counterspell} or {@spell dispel magic} against a spell you know, you have advantage on the saving throw or spellcasting ability check.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you make a saving throw against a spell you know, or make a spellcasting ability check to use counterspell or dispel magic against a spell you know

optionalfeature.name: Manipulate Magic
entries: You learn one Metamagic option of your choice from the sorcerer class. You can use this Metamagic option once, ignoring its sorcery point cost, up to a maximum of 3 points, and regaining the ability to use it again after completing a long rest. You can use it again by expending a spell slot of a level equal to the number of sorcery points the Metamagic would costs to use.

optionalfeature.name: Mass Cantrip
entries: When you cast an Occultist cantrip that targets one or more creatures, you can make the cantrip target a number additional creatures within range equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this rite in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. You can instead expend a spell slot to gain a similar effect, causing the cantrip to target a number of additional creatures equal to the level of spell slot spent.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you cast an Occultist cantrip that targets one or more creatures

optionalfeature.name: Mastered Basics
entries: When you cast an Occultist spell you know using a 1st level spell slot, it is cast as if you spent a 2nd level spell slot instead.

optionalfeature.name: Practice Makes Perfect
entries: You've cast a spell so many times it has become second nature. Select a 1st level Occulist spell you know. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your half your proficiency bonus (rounded up), regaining all uses when you complete a long rest.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you cast the selected spell

optionalfeature.name: Practiced Reach
entries: When you use the Way I Learned It feature to add range, you can make the range of the spell up to 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: Your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Savant Focus
entries: You can focus all of your experience into using your most magic potently. As a bonus action you can enter a state of focused concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. When you so, you gain advantage on attack rolls made for cantrips for 1 minute, or until you end your concentration on this state of focus.

optionalfeature.name: Simple Magic
entries: Even as you gain power, you are adept with using it small bursts for simple magic. You can sacrifice a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to gain two 1st level spell slots. If the spell slot is 5th level or higher, you can gain 2nd level spell slots. You cannot store more than twice your usual maximum number of any spell slot level this way.

optionalfeature.name: Studious Mage
entries: {@i (You can take this Rite multiple times)}

You can select spell from the Wizard or Druid spell list, but only of a spell level lower than the highest level spell level you can cast (for example, a 3rd level Occultist can select a 1st level Wizard or Druid spell).

optionalfeature.name: Utility Master
entries: When you cast utility cantrips that can lift weight, effect areas of elements, target area on the ground, or cause minor instantaneous effects, you lift twice as much, target twice as much area, or maintain an additional instantaneous effect.

optionalfeature.name: Death Watcher
entries: You can see the lines of fate, and detect when one of them is about to snap. When an ally that can see or hear you would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you can manipulate their fate with a cryptic warning, causing them to narrowly avoid their demise, instead dropping to 1 hit point.
Once you use this Rite, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When an ally that can see or hear you would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage

optionalfeature.name: Divine Miracle
entries: You learn one {@filter cleric spell|spells|class=cleric} of your choice. The spell must be of a level you can learn, and becomes an Occultist spell for you. The spell does not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Sight
entries: If you have {@sense blindsight}, you gain {@sense truesight} with a range equal to your blindsight.

optionalfeature.name: Oracle's Sight
entries: You gain {@sense blindsight} with a range of 15 feet. When affected by the {@condition Blinded} condition for more than a minute the range of this sight is doubled while under that effect.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Darkness
entries: You understand that all is darkness, interrupted only by tenuous motes of light. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher creates dim light, darkness, or that obscures you from the vision of one or more creatures, you can teleport to another point you can see that is in dim light or darkness within 30 feet as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Death
entries: You can directly touch on the negative energy. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold or necrotic damage, you can add your Wisdom modifier to one damage roll of that spell. Channeling the power of death in this way temporarily withers and weakens you, reducing your movement speed by 5 feet until the end of your next turn.
If you use this while already weakened in this way, the duration is extended and the effect is cumulative. A spell can only trigger one Revelation. If multiple Revelations apply, choose one.

foundrySystem.activation.condiion: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold or necrotic damage

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Fire
entries: Your powers draw flames all around you. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, you can shroud yourself in flames until the start of your next turn. You gain you half cover, and any creature that strikes you with a melee weapon or attack or ends their turn within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. At the start of your next turn, you take 1 fire damage.
A spell can only trigger one revelation. If multiple revelations apply, choose one.

foundrySystem.activation.condiion: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Life
entries: Your powers are tied to the nature of life and its ever shifting balance. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points or grants temporary hit points, you can heal a creature other than yourself within 30 feet for a number of hit points equal to your Occultist level. Your current hit points are reduced by half as many hit points as you restore with this feature.

You can only use this ability on creatures that have vibrant life pulsing within them. This revelation does not work on undead, constructs, or creatures at zero hit points. A spell can only trigger one revelation. If multiple revelations apply, choose one.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Light
entries: You grasp that looking into the light blinds as surely as looking away from it. When you cast {@spell prismatic flash|BelzorMM} or a 1st level spell or higher spell that shreds 5 feet or more or bright light, as a bonus action you can force one creature within 30 feet of the light to make a Dexterity saving throw, or become {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.
A creature is unaffected by this effect if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as {@sense blindsight}, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with {@sense truesight}.

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of Souls
entries: The souls of the departed are all around. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can conjure a benevolent spirit or a tormented spirit to empty space you can see within 30 feet, filling a 5 foot cube.

The first creature to enter the spirit's space or end their turn within the spirit's space gains a number of hit points equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell if you summoned a benevolent spirit, or takes damage equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell if the spirit was a tormented one. A spell can only trigger one revelation. If multiple revelations apply, choose one.

foundrySystem.activation.condiion: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points or grants temporary hit points

optionalfeature.name: Revelation of War
entries: Within war and conflict you see the true essence of perfect conflict. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on your turn, you can make a single melee weapon attack as bonus action. When you reach 6th level, you can trigger the Revelation of War when you cast an Occultist cantrip.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Fire
entries: You learn the cantrip {@spell burn|BelzorMM}. Additionally, as a bonus action you can take 1 fire damage and can cause a weapon you are carrying to burst into flames for 1 minute or until you let go of it. For the duration, it sheds bright light for 10 feet and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Attacks made with the weapon while it burns deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Darkness
entries: Fear of darkness comes from an addition to light. Any darksight or {@sense blindsight} you have is doubled in range, up to a maximum of 120 feet. If you have neither, you gain a {@sense darkvision} of 30 feet, which is doubled by this feature to 60 feet. You can see normally in dim light and darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Light
entries: The light reveals all. Magical bright light you create reveals {@condition invisible} creatures, any attempt to hide within it is made with disadvantage, and grants advantage on saving throws and ability against illusions. You can end these effects for the duration of that bright light on a source of bright light as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Death
entries: The march of death is inexorable. Necrotic damage you deal ignores resistance to Necrotic damage, and treats immunity as resistance, and leaves the touch of death on the target until the start of your next turn. While under the Touch of Death, any hit points the target regains is halved (rounded down).

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you deal necrotic damage to a creature

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Fire
entries: Everything burns. When you roll fire damage, you can reroll any number of fire damage dice. You must use the new rolls. If you reroll all the dice of the damage roll, the damage bypasses any fire resistance a target has. For each die rerolled, you take 1 fire damage which can't be reduced in any way.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Life
entries: The breath of life is shared by all creatures. When a creature dies within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to transfer some of that dispersing life force to another creature within 60 feet of you (including yourself). The target creature gains hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier, or the maximum hit points of the creature (whichever was lower).

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When a creature dies within 60 feet of you

optionalfeature.name: Truth of Souls
entries: You are one with the souls. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells granted by the {@optfeature Mystery of Souls|BelzorMM}.

optionalfeature.name: Truth of War
entries: There are many paths to victory. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on your turn, the next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before the end of your turn, you can force them to make a Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC, or suffer from a condition based on the level of spell slot cast (you can select the condition of a lower level effect instead of you choose) until the start of your next turn. The type of saves and conditions are listed on the table below.

optionalfeature.name: Twin Revelation
entries: When you cast a spell that invokes a Revelation, you can invoke two different Revelations at the same time.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Elements
entries: You learn the {@spell form of fire|KibbleTasty:CC}, {@spell form of ice|KibbleTasty:CC}, and {@spell form of stone|KibbleTasty:CC} spells. These are Occultist spells for you. When you cast one of these spells, you can choose to shorten the duration of the spell to 1 minute. When you do so, these spells do not require concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of the Spirits
entries: When you cast {@spell spirit guardians}, you can choose what damage type it does from any of cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, and radiant, regardless of your alignment.
Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saves to maintain concentration on spirit guardians and {@spell healing spirit|XGE}.

optionalfeature.name: Detonate Spirit
entries: As an action you can detonate a {@subclassFeature Call Spirit|Occultist|BelzorMM|Shaman|BelzorMM|1|BelzorMM|manifested spirit}, causing it to erupt in flare of power. All creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes damage equal to twice the manifested damage of spirit on a failed save. If the spirit was empowered with a spell slot, a target takes half as much damage on a successful one. The spirit is immediately released and disappears.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: When you create a weapon with {@spell fists of fire|BelzorMM} or {@spell ice weapon|BelzorMM} the damage die of the weapon is increased by one size (for example, from a d6 to a d8).

optionalfeature.name: Energized Weapon
entries: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon with the power granted to you by the spirits. While you have an {@subclassFeature Empowered Spirits|Occultist|BelzorMM|Shaman|BelzorMM|3|BelzorMM|empowered spirit} bonded, you can pour all of its energy into your weapon (recalling it if it is manifested). The next attack with that weapon adds twice the additional damage from the spirit, but the bond immediately expires.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: While you have an empowered spirit bonded

optionalfeature.name: Guidance of the Spirits
entries: When you expend a spell slot to empower a spirit with your {@subclassFeature Empowered Spirits|Occultist|BelzorMM|Shaman|BelzorMM|3|BelzorMM} feature, you can select a number of skills equal to the spell slot expended that the spirit is proficient in. While it is not manifested, you gain proficiency with these skills. If you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can exchange three of the skills the spirit gaining expertise in one skill.

optionalfeature.name: Mistwalker
entries: You can see through heavy obscurement when the obscurement is caused by fog, mist, or smoke, natural or otherwise. While you are shrouded by fog, mist, or smoke, you have half cover.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Bond
entries: When you are empowered by a spirit called by a 1st level spell slot or higher, you can add the level of the spell slot spent to your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Earth
entries: You harness the primal elemental powers of the earth and stone to your call, you learn the following spells at the following levels, but they do not count against your spells known. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Ice
entries: You harness the primal elemental powers of ice to your call, you learn the following spells at the following levels, but they do not count against your spells known. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Fire
entries: You harness the primal elemental powers of fire to your call, you learn the following spells at the following levels, but they do not count against your spells known. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Storm
entries: You harness the primal elemental powers of storms and lightning to your call, you learn the following spells at the following levels, but they do not count against your spells known.These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Deflection
entries: You can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of your Dexterity modifier, when determining your AC in light or medium armor, or when using {@spell mage armor}.

optionalfeature.name: Radiate Power
entries: While you have a spirit bonded to you, as a bonus action you can cause it to emanate power, causing all creatures within 5 feet of you (or it if it is manifested at another location) to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, or take damage equal to its manifested damage.

optionalfeature.name: Rite of Prowess
entries: You can select one fighting style from {@optfeature Dueling}, {@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting}, or {@optfeature Great Weapon Fighting}.

optionalfeature.name: Shaman's Touch
entries: When you use your action to cast a {@filter cantrip with a range of touch|spells|range=touch|level=0}, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Power
entries: You learn the spell {@spell shield}. It becomes an Occultist spell for you, but does not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Possession
entries: Your Malignant Possession chills the target, reducing the movement speed of the target by 10 feet while under the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Contagious Possession
entries: If a creature dies while under the effect of Malignant Possession, you can force another creature within 30 feet of it to make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, it becomes under the effect of Malignant Possession. You cannot use this feature if the creature died from the effects of Destructive Possession.

optionalfeature.name: Controlled Convulsion
entries: When your Malignant Possession causes the attacker to miss the target with a melee attack, you can redirect the attack to another creature within range of the attack. The new attack makes a new attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Destructive Possession
entries: As an action you can end the Malignant Possession of a creature by denoting the spirit within them, forcing them to make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, they take 2d8 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save. The damage increases by 2d8 for each point of proficiency bonus above 2.

optionalfeature.name: Expansive Totems
entries: The area of effect on your totems that affect a 10 foot radius expands to 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Ghost Step
entries: You learn the ghost step spell, and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it again without a spell slot when you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Lethargic Possession
entries: When you use Malignant Possession, the spirit saps the target's energy. They gain 1 level of exhaustion while the spirit haunts them. This level of exhaustion ends if the spirit stops haunting them.

optionalfeature.name: Restraining Totem
entries: Your Grasping Totem restrains creatures while they are grappled by it

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Eye
entries: You can cast arcane eye without expending a spell slot, with the eye taking the form of an invisible spirit. Once you cast it this way, you cannot cast it this way again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Wards
entries: You gain the effect of {@i protection from evil and good} against all incorporeal spirits and undead.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Conversationalist
entries: You learn the spell speak with dead and can cast the spell without a spell slot once, regaining the ability to do so again on a long rest.
Additionally, speak with dead is a ritual spell for you.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Master
entries: You regain one use of your Totem Binding feature when you complete a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Savant
entries: You learn an additional totem from your Totem Binding feature

optionalfeature.name: Totem Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch places with any of your totems within 60 feet (teleport to an empty space within 5 feet of it, and the totem teleporting it to a point adjacent to the space you teleported from).

optionalfeature.name: Twin Totems
entries: When you use your Totem Binding feature you call forth two different totems at the same time with a single use of the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Broom
entries: You infuse an object - traditionally a broom, but can be any vaguely broom-shaped object (like a spear, staff, or similar) - with flying magic, turning it into a {@item Broom of Flying} (basic rules, pg. 156). If your broom is lost or destroyed, you can create a new one during 8 hours of work. If a previous broom still exists when you make a new one, it loses its magic upon the completion of the new one.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Hair
entries: As an action, you can expend a 1st level spell slot to cause your hair to lengthen, strengthen, and spring to life for 1 minute. When you use this feature and as an action on your subsequent turns while it is animated you can make melee spell attack with a range of 10 feet, dealing {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage on hit. This damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th Level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}). If you hit a Large or smaller creature with this attack, as a bonus action you can attempt to {@action grapple} the creature with your hair using your Wisdom modifier in place of your Strength modifier to initiate and maintain grapple.

A {@condition grappled} creature can contest the grapple as normal, or deal 5 slashing, fire, or acid damage to the hair to free themselves. The hair has an AC of 12, and you take no damage when it is attacked.

optionalfeature.name: Companion Coven
entries: As a ritual that takes 1 hour, you can form a coven bond with one willing creature that has spell slots. While both of you are conscious and within 120 feet of each other, you gain the ability to share spell slots up to a spell slot level of your Witch level divided by four (rounded down), minimum of 1st level slots. While this bond is active, you can use your Spellcasting feature to cast using their spell slots (consuming them as normal), and they can use their Spellcasting feature (if they have one) to cast using your qualifying spell slots (consuming them as normal).

Additionally, you know their location at all times while they are part of your coven and within 120 feet of you. You can only be bonded to one creature with this bond at a time. You can end this coven at any time.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Presence
entries: Your familiar is always under the effect of {@spell Sanctuary}. If it deals damage (such as channeling one of your spells), the effect is suppressed until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Evil Eye
entries: You gain the ability to lay the most unsettling gaze upon a creature. As a reaction to a creature within 15 feet attacking you, you can unleash a terrifying glare at them (occuring after the attack completes). The target creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. Once a creature has passed a save against this ability, they are immune to it for 24 hours.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: A creature within 15 feet attacks you

optionalfeature.name: Familiar Swap
entries: If your familiar is within 60 feet of you, as an action, you can swap places with your familiar. If you cannot fit into the space where your familiar is, the ability fails and you take {@damage 1d6} force damage. Once you use this Rite, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: If your familiar is within 60 feet of you

optionalfeature.name: Form of the Familiar
entries: You learn the {@spell form of familiar|BelzorMM} spell, and gain the ability to cast it once without expending a spell slot as an action. You regain the ability to cast it in this way again after completing a short or long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

optionalfeature.name: Rites of the Moon
entries: You learn the ancient rites of the moon and the powers that hold, opening new pathways of magic to you. You learn the following spells at the following levels. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Riding Familiar
entries: If you have a familiar without a flying speed, as an action you can make them become a creature one size larger than you (up to Large sized) for 8 hours. As an action, you can revert your familiar to its normal size. At 12th level, you can use this ability to become familiar with flying speed. Once you do this, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest. Your familiar's strength becomes 10 while enlarged, if it was not already higher.

optionalfeature.name: Skulking Familiar
entries: Any familiar summoned by you gains proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill, and its movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Brew
entries: During a short or long rest, you can infuse a spell with a casting time of one action or bonus action into a concoction, expending the spell slot on completion of the rest.

This spell can subsequently be cast by anyone carrying the potion by drinking the potion as an action, with the drinker as the target, acting as the caster of the spell, but using the Witch's spell casting ability modifier.
The potion remains potent until you complete a long rest and recharge the spell slot expended to create the potion.

entries.name: Alchemist Rules
entries: If your group uses the {@link KibbleTasty Artificer|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-LAEn6ZdC6lYUKhQ67Qk}, you can use the rules for Alchemical Infusions (Artificer, pg 17) for this feature, but can only make 1 potion during a short or long rest with it, and using the your Spells Known as the valid selection options.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: During a short or long rest

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Claws
entries: As an action, you can form nails form into wicked claws and you make a melee spell attack agack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} + your Wisdom modifier slashing damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}). At 6th level, you can apply your Witch's Touch feature when you hit with this attack (including potentially dealing your Wisdom modifier damage twice).

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Hat
entries: You invest a hat (traditionally a floppy wide brimmed black witch's hat) with some of your magic, turning it into a {@item hat of disguise}. If your hat is lost or destroyed, you can create a new one with 2 hours of work. If a previous hat still exists when you make a new one, it loses its magic upon the completion of the new one.

optionalfeature.name: Chaotic Thesis
entries: When you use your Void Gaze or They Watch feature, you can choose which effect you want, selecting any of the Eschatological Conclusion effects. You can select different effects for each eye for the They Watch feature.

optionalfeature.name: Conviction of Annihilation
entries: Your conviction toward your thesis grows, allowing you to draw on additional aspects of it and learn the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Conviction of Madness
entries: Your conviction toward your thesis grows, allowing you to draw on additional aspects of it and learn the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Conviction of Tranquility
entries: Your conviction toward your thesis grows, allowing you to draw on additional aspects of it and learn the following spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. These are Occultist spells for you, but do not count against your spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Cycle of Annihilation
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with Void Gaze, you can immediately use the ability again targeting another creature within range as part of the same action. You can do this a maximum number of times in a turn equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of the Mad Puppet
entries: When a target is compelled to move by an Occultist spell you cast, you can pick the direction the target moves, even if you would normally not be able to (for example, a spell that causes the target to run away from you can be used to make the target run in any direction). This does not change a target's willingness to enter hazardous spaces.

optionalfeature.name: Diciple of Discord
entries: You thrive on chaos and discord. Any time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that causes a target creature to become act against their will, become frightened, or take psychic damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Doombringer
entries: When you roll a Fate Die for a creature using the Eye of the End, you can subtract your Wisdom modifier from the roll determining the result of their next save.

optionalfeature.name: Ending Spoilers
entries: You can use your Eye of the End feature as a bonus action

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Gaze
entries: If a creature ends its turn within the cone of sight of one the eyes created by They Watch, it has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Inexorable Annihilation
entries: Creatures that fail a saving throw against your 1st level or higher Occultist spells that deal damage gain lingering cracks in their form which slowly erode them. They take 1d6 force damage at the end of each their turns. This ends after dealing damage if the creature is more than 120 feet from you, you cannot see the creature, or you are incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Reflexive Annihilation
entries: When you take damage from another creature within 60 feet of you, you can temporarily let loose the annihilation within you as revenge. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking a number of d6 dice equal to your proficiency bonus as force damage on failure, and half the damage on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Self Reflection
entries: When grant temporary hit points with Conclusion of Tranquility to another creature, you gain an equal number of temporary hit points

optionalfeature.name: Serene Acceptance
entries: You remain calm and unperturbed by the chaos around you, as you wait calmly for the end of reality. You gain advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells, and advantage on any ability check to maintain a calm state of mind, expression, or demeanor.

optionalfeature.name: This is Fine
entries: You remain unpreturbed in even the most dire circumstances. You become immune to the fightened condition.

optionalfeature.name: True Voidsight
entries: You gain truesight for the duration of your Void Gaze.

optionalfeature.name: Tranquil Touch
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on a creature, you can choose to end the charmed or frightened condition on that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Unflinching Gaze
entries: You gain an additional use of your Void Gaze feature, and no longer have to make a saving throw against blindness when the feature ends when using it again before completing a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Unmaking Eye
entries: When you use your Eye of the End feature, your next melee weapon attack against the target creature becomes a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Wildcard
entries: You can no longer choose which option to use with your Void Gaze, but roll randomly to determine the effect. In exchange, the effect gains additional die of temporary hit points or damage (for example, Conclusion of Annhilation would deal 2d8 force damage). You can pick the target after rolling for the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Totem
entries: Any creature of your choice that starts its turn within 10 feet of the totem or enters within 10 feet of it for the first time on their turn takes 1d6 necrotic damage. Any creature that damages the totem from within 10 feet of it takes 1d6 necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Binding Totem
entries: Terrain within 10 feet of the totem is difficult terrain for creatures of your choice, and any creature attempting to teleport into or out of the radius must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC, or the attempt fails

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Totem
entries: When you create the totem, it attempts to bind a Large or smaller creature of your choice within 10 feet, forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On failure, they are pulled to within 5 feet of the totem and grappled by it (escape DC equals your spell save DC). This totem cannot be made mobile by other effects or features.

optionalfeature.name: Life Totem
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the totem you can heal them with the totem for 1d6 hit points. The totem does this a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, after which its power fades and it crumbles.

optionalfeature.name: Sanctuary Totem
entries: All creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the totem are under the effect of sanctuary. This effect is broken under the normal  conditions of sanctuary and cannot be regained from a totem for 1 minute once lost.

optionalfeature.name: Shrouding Totem
entries: All creatures and objects (including the totem) within 10 feet of the totemare lightly obscured from creatures beyond 10 feet of the totem, and gain the benefits of half cover against ranged attack rolls originating from outside the totem's radius.

optionalfeature.name: Soothing Totem
entries: All creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the totem have advantage on saving throws against being Charmed or Frightened.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Totem
entries: All creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the totem gain resistance to all damage, but the totem takes damage equal to the damage taken by creatures that benefit from the resistance (which can destroy the totem, ending the effect).

optionalfeature.name: Aether
entries: You have a flying speed of 20 feet for 1 hour. However, you have disadvantage on Strength checks and Dexterity checks during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Cruelty
entries: When you use the Attack action, you can make one additional weapon attack as a bonus action. However, you have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. However, you have disadvantage on Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Reconstruction
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns when you have at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half your hit point maximum, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. However, your speed is reduced by 10 feet during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to enhance your appearance and presence. You have advantage on Charisma checks. However, you have disadvantage on initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws. Your Dexterity score and your maximum increase by 4 if you consume this mutagen at 11th level, and by 5 at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Conversant
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence checks. However, you have disadvantage on Wisdom checks.

optionalfeature.name: Deftness
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity checks. However, you have disadvantage on Wisdom checks.

optionalfeature.name: Embers
entries: You have resistance to fire damage and vulnerability to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Gelid
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and vulnerability to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Impermeable
entries: You have resistance to piercing damage and vulnerability to slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile
entries: You have immunity to the {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} conditions. However, you have disadvantage on Strength checks. At 11th level, you are also immune to the {@condition paralyzed} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Nighteye
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet. However, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: Percipient
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom checks. However, you have disadvantage on Charisma checks.

optionalfeature.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. Your Strength score and your maximum increase by 4 if you consume this mutagen at 11th level, and by 5 at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Rapidity
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet. However, you have disadvantage on Intelligence checks. At 15th level, your speed increases by an additional 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 3, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have disadvantage on Charisma saving throws. Your Intelligence score and your maximum increase by 4 if you consume this mutagen at 11th level, and by 5 at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Shielded
entries: You have resistance to slashing damage, and you have vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning damage, and you have vulnerability to piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. However, you have disadvantage on death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Agility
entries: You are under the effect of the jump spell during the effect

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Armor
entries: You are under the effect of the mage armor spell during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Swiftness
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Enchanted Shield
entries: You touch a shield making it easy to wield. You have proficiency with that shield during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Surging Saves
entries: You can use your Arcane Surge to add your Intelligence modifier to Strength or Dexterity saving throws as well as ability checks (no action required), expending a use as you would to empower an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Barrier
entries: You reduce all damage taken by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Focus
entries: You turn your weapon into an arcane focus for your Spellblade spells.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Eyes
entries: You gain the ability to see in the dark. You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Style
entries: While this Aegis is active, you gain one Fighting Style option of your choice from the Fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.

optionalfeature.name: Blade Channel
entries: When you can cast a spell using Spellstrike, you can use the ability modifier used to attack with that weapon instead of your Intelligence for the spellcasting ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Illusionary Ally
entries: When you roll initiative, you create a single duplicate as per the mirror image spell. You can only have one duplicate at a time from this effect. If you cast mirror image during the effect, the spell remains the same, but the first time an image is lost, this duplicate is destroyed instead.

optionalfeature.name: Loyal Weapon
entries: A weapon you touch as part of selecting this Aegis is under the effect of the Returning Weapon enchantment

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Movement
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 5.

optionalfeature.name: Aether Barrier
entries: When you deal damage with your Aether Blade, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Shield
entries: You can create a shield of arcane power that protects you, blocking incoming attacks. You gain a +2 to AC as if you had a shield equipped. This counts as an equipped shield but does not require the use of your hand, and you cannot benefit from both this and an equipped shield.

optionalfeature.name: Blastwave
entries: Whenever you teleport using an Arcane Surge or a spell of 1st level or higher spell during the effect, your Aegis sends out a blastwave. Creatures of your choice within 5 feet of your destination must make a Strength saving throw against your Spell Save DC or be knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Contingent Blink
entries: The first time you would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you instead drop to 1 hit point, and vanish from your plane of existence, appearing on the Ethereal Plane. At the start of your turn, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from. Once triggered, this cannot be triggered again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage during the effect. You may select a new damage type when you select this Aegis again.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Contingency
entries: You incorporate a contingency for rapidly deploying combat magic into your Aegis. When you roll initiative, as a reaction you can cast one spell of 3rd level or lower spell that affects only you and has a casting time of 1 action.

optionalfeature.name: Dimensional Pathways
entries: When you use Arcane Surge to teleport, you can take one willing Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of you with you, teleporting them to within 5 feet of your destination.

optionalfeature.name: Runic Strength
entries: Your Strength score becomes equal to your Intelligence score during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 30 feet during the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Alacrity
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can attack twice, instead of once.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Aegis
entries: You reduce all damage taken by 5.

optionalfeature.name: Resilient Aegis
entries: You gain proficiency in one Saving Throw of your choice during the effect.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aldani mature at the same rate as humans, but can live up to twice as long, around 200 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Aldani live in peaceful societies that follow strict, non-violent codes of conduct, save for organised duels. They tend toward lawful and neutral alignments

entries.name: Size
entries: Aldani are around 8 feet long, rising to a height of 5 feet or so. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 20 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your enormous pincers are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Strength modifier.

A target hit by your claw attack is {@condition grappled}. You have two claws, each of which can grapple only one target. The escape DC for this grapple is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Underwater Adaption
entries: You ignore any drawbacks caused by an underwater environment.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

The aldani, or lobsterfolk, are a rare sight in the Forgotten Realms. These creatures resemble giant lobsters that walk upright and have humanoid faces save for the chitinous armour that clads them, and their eyestalks. Aldani vary in colour, red Aldani are common in Chult, and blue in the Trackless Sea.

Aldani are peaceful yet xenophobic. The aldani of Chult live almost exclusively in the Aldani Basin, where they stay in seclusion from the surrounding sentient races. The lobsterfolk of the Trackless Sea are often found in monasteries in the pursuit of inner peace

entries.name: Aldani Names
entries: Aldani take names similar to the local humans. Their primary language is Common, thus taking human names is easy for them. Despite this, lobsterfolk can communicate through a second language, a series of clacks and snaps produced by their pincers. An individual aldani might have a series of sounds it uses instead. Aldani care little for family lines, nor do they make any distinction between genders or sexes, thus all aldani use a single, unisex name.

As beings forged from the unholy union of dragons and the undead, Draconic Revenants possess a unique set of racial traits that reflect their dual nature and the powers bestowed upon them by their draconic ancestors. These traits encompass both physical and magical aspects, making Draconic Revenants formidable and versatile beings.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, reflecting the unnatural resilience of your undead nature.

entries.name: Age
entries: Draconic Revenants have varying lifespans depending on their undead nature. While they do not experience natural aging, their existence is tied to the preservation of their physical form. As long as they maintain their undead state, they can potentially live for centuries, their lifespan dictated by the preservation of their bodies and the forces that sustain them.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Draconic Revenants tend to possess a strong sense of determination and ambition, stemming from their draconic heritage. They are often driven by their own goals and desires, which can lead them to align with any alignment on the spectrum. However, due to the lingering influence of the undead, many lean towards neutral or lawful alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Draconic Revenants typically have a similar build to humans, standing between 5 and 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Draconic, and Undercommon, showcasing the history of the Undead and Draconic lineage in your blood.

entries.name: Dragon Ancestry
entries: Choose one of the following dragon types: Black, Blue, Green, Red, or White. This choice determines the damage type of your Draconic Breath (described below)

entries.name: Draconic Breath
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy in a 15-foot cone. The damage type is determined by your dragon ancestry. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level. After you use your Draconic Breath, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. The damage type of this trait relies on your Dragon Ancestry:

entries.name: Resilience of the Undead
entries: Due to your undead nature, you have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and diseases.

These formidable humanoid creatures are the result of a dark ritual that merges the essence of dragons and undead. Draconic Revenants possess the physical characteristics and elemental affinity of their draconic ancestors, combined with the unnerving resilience and necrotic powers of the undead.

entries.name: Origins and Histories
entries: Deep within the annals of dark magic and forbidden rituals lies the enigmatic tale of the Draconic Revenants. These formidable beings are the result of a sinister process that merges the essence of dragons and the lingering specter of the undead. The origins of the Draconic Revenants can be traced back to a time when desperate and ambitious sorcerers sought to harness the immense power of dragons, transcending the boundaries of mortality itself.

Legend has it that these sorcerers delved deep into the forbidden tomes of necromancy and sought the arcane knowledge required to awaken dormant draconic spirits and bind them to the ethereal remains of the undead. Through a complex and treacherous ritual, they called upon the very essence of dragons and forced them into an unholy union with the necrotic remnants of deceased creatures.

It is whispered that the earliest Draconic Revenants were created during a time of great upheaval, when dark empires vied for dominion and sought to wield the immense power of dragons as their ultimate weapon. These necromantic sorcerers, driven by their insatiable thirst for power and domination, sought to manipulate the forces of life and death to their advantage.

The process of creating a Draconic Revenant is an intricate and dangerous one, involving the mastery of both draconic magic and necromantic arts. The sorcerers carefully selected deceased creatures whose souls still clung to the material plane, using their remains as the vessel for the ritual. Through an elaborate series of incantations, arcane circles, and sacrificial offerings, they managed to bridge the gap between life and death, merging the essence of dragons with the lingering specter of the undead.

Upon the completion of the ritual, the dormant draconic spirits were awakened, their powers fused with the necrotic energy of the undead. The result was a creature that retained the physical characteristics and elemental affinity of their draconic ancestors, but also possessed the unnerving resilience and necrotic powers of the undead. The once-sleeping dragon blood surged through the veins of the newly formed Draconic Revenant, infusing them with a potent blend of raw draconic might and deathly magic.

As word of these abominable creations spread, fear and awe gripped the realms. Many viewed the Draconic Revenants as an abhorrent perversion of nature and an affront to the divine order. They were shunned and hunted by those who saw them as a blight upon the world, a mockery of both dragonkind and the sanctity of life. Others, however, saw their potential as powerful allies or feared adversaries, recognizing the unique blend of powers they possessed.

Throughout history, tales of the Draconic Revenants have been woven into the fabric of legends and folklore. They are often depicted as tragic figures, torn between their draconic heritage and the burden of undeath. Some seek to reclaim their lost humanity, striving to redeem themselves from the abomination they have become. Others revel in the dark powers bestowed upon them, embracing their dual nature as both dragon and undead.

In the present day, the presence of Draconic Revenants is a rare and ominous sight. They walk the realms as beings of both fascination and dread, often cloaked in mystery and surrounded by whispered rumors. Adventurers who encounter these formidable creatures must tread carefully, for their allegiance is uncertain, and their motives can be as fickle as the shifting winds.

Thus, the origins and histories of the Draconic Revenants remain shrouded in darkness, their true purpose and ultimate fate yet to be unveiled. As they continue to stride through the realms, their stories intertwine with those of heroes and villains alike, leaving an indelible mark upon the tapestry of the world and serving as a reminder of the potent forces that lie beyond the mortal realm.

entries.name: Physical Characteristics
entries: Draconic Revenants are imposing humanoid beings that bear the unmistakable hallmarks of both dragons and the undead. Their appearance is a testament to the unholy fusion of these two disparate entities, resulting in a creature that is at once fearsome and hauntingly beautiful.

Standing tall and proud, Draconic Revenants possess a commanding presence that demands attention. They often exceed the average height of a human, with their draconic lineage manifesting in their regal posture and a sense of innate authority. Their physical forms exhibit a remarkable blend of draconic and undead traits, making them instantly recognizable as beings forged from two distinct worlds.

One of the most striking features of a Draconic Revenant is their scales. Resembling those of their dragon ancestors, these scales come in a wide array of vibrant colors, ranging from the brilliant iridescence of metallic hues to the deep, ominous shades of chromatic scales. Each scale is tough and resilient, serving as a natural armor that protects the Draconic Revenant from harm.

Their eyes, shining with an otherworldly glow, are often reminiscent of the dragon type they are linked to. Fiery red orbs hint at a connection to the ferocious red dragons, while piercing blue or green eyes reflect a bond with their chromatic counterparts. These eyes possess an intensity that can unsettle even the bravest of souls, hinting at the depths of power and wisdom hidden within.

Draconic Revenants bear a strong resemblance to the humanoids from which their undead forms were forged, yet their features possess an otherworldly refinement. Their visage exudes an aura of ethereal beauty, even in the case of those whose dragon lineage is tied to creatures traditionally considered monstrous. It is as though the melding of dragon and undead has elevated their physical form to a higher state of grace.

A notable feature of Draconic Revenants is the presence of draconic wings, sprouting majestically from their backs. These wings, a symbol of their draconic heritage, possess a grandeur that rivals those of their full-blooded dragon kin. While not all Draconic Revenants possess wings, those who do can effortlessly take to the skies, soaring with an otherworldly grace that is both awe-inspiring and intimidating.

In addition to their striking appearance, Draconic Revenants possess an unnatural resilience that stems from their undead nature. They are immune to diseases and poisons, and their bodies are remarkably resistant to the ravages of time. This resilience grants them a supernatural endurance, allowing them to withstand injuries that would incapacitate or kill a mortal being.

While Draconic Revenants retain humanoid forms, they possess a strength and physical prowess that surpasses that of most mortal creatures. Their bodies are honed by draconic power, granting them exceptional agility, speed, and dexterity. This, combined with their inherent resistance to harm, makes them formidable adversaries in combat, capable of delivering devastating blows and shrugging off the most lethal of attacks.

However, their undead nature comes with a price. Draconic Revenants do not breathe or require sustenance, and their hearts remain still within their chests. This lack of life force renders them immune to effects that target the living, but it also means they are cut off from the joys and necessities of mortal existence. They are forever bound to the realm of the undead, caught between life and death, their existence fueled by the lingering energy of dragons and necromantic forces.

entries.name: Cultural Customs and Society
entries: Within the enigmatic realm of the Draconic Revenants, a unique culture and society have emerged, shaped by their dual nature as beings of dragon and undead. These formidable creatures possess their own customs, traditions, and ways of life that reflect the complexities of their existence and their place within the realms.

At the heart of Draconic Revenant society lies a deep reverence for their draconic heritage. They cherish the memories and tales of their dragon ancestors, seeking to uphold the ideals and values associated with these legendary beings. Dragons are viewed as paragons of power, wisdom, and dominance, and Draconic Revenants strive to embody these qualities in their own lives.

The society of Draconic Revenants is often organized into distinct clans or broods, each tracing its lineage back to a particular type of dragon. These clans form the bedrock of their social structure, providing a sense of belonging and shared identity. Each clan operates with its own hierarchy, led by an elder or chieftain who embodies the essence and wisdom of their respective dragon ancestor.

Within these clans, intricate rituals and ceremonies take place, often centered around the veneration of dragons and the remembrance of their ancestors. Draconic Revenants pay homage to their dragon lineage through offerings, prayers, and acts of devotion. These rituals serve as a means to strengthen their connection to their draconic heritage and reinforce their ties to the realms of dragons and the undead.

In Draconic Revenant culture, the pursuit of knowledge is highly valued. They seek to amass wisdom and arcane understanding, delving into ancient tomes and exploring the mysteries of the realms. Libraries and sanctuaries dedicated to the accumulation and preservation of knowledge are revered spaces within their society. It is through the pursuit of knowledge that Draconic Revenants hope to unlock the secrets of their existence and transcend the limitations imposed upon them by their dual nature.

Honorable combat holds great significance in Draconic Revenant culture. They believe in the power of physical prowess and the demonstration of martial skill. Ritualistic duels and contests of strength are common, serving not only as a means of resolving disputes but also as a form of entertainment and a way to prove oneself within the society. Such contests are often accompanied by intricate displays of martial arts, magical prowess, and the unleashing of draconic powers.

Given their unique abilities and connection to the undead, Draconic Revenants often find themselves navigating the delicate balance between the realms of life and death. They possess a profound respect for the cycle of existence and the mysteries that lie beyond mortal understanding. Funerary rites and ceremonies hold deep importance for them, as they commemorate the passing of both their own kind and other creatures. These rituals serve as a reminder of the impermanence of life and the eternal nature of the soul.

While Draconic Revenants are capable of forming alliances and bonds with other races, their society is often insular and cautious. They are acutely aware of the prejudice and fear that their existence can evoke in others, and thus, they tend to keep their true nature hidden from those who may not understand or accept them. As a result, Draconic Revenant communities are often hidden away in remote and secretive locations.

The notion of honor and loyalty holds great sway in Draconic Revenant culture. They value oaths and commitments, and breaking one's word is seen as a grave offense. Trust and loyalty are paramount within their society, and betrayal is met with swift and severe consequences. Despite their undead nature, Draconic Revenants hold themselves to a strict code of conduct, striving to maintain their dignity and honor amidst the shadows that surround them.

My mother once told me a story about the stars, heavenly entities that guide us from above, constantly watching over us from the night sky. She told me she'd met one once. I had thought she was joking.

entries.name: Nebulous Origins
entries: The star genasi are born from the wishes of a mortal upon a star. They are the might and mind of heavenly bodies, and draw their power from the glowing core they carry in place of a heart, a shard of their parent star. This core grants them the power to illuminate the dark.

entries.name: Otherworldly Appearance
entries: Star genasi are strange creatures, with dark-blue skin that blends with the night sky and eyes containing the light of thousands of galaxies. They have silvery hair that shimmers with starlight in the light of day, the specks of light that infuse their skin and hair becoming less pronounced during the daytime. However, their eyes still bear the light of countless stars.

entries.name: Star Genasi Names
entries: Star genasi use the naming conventions of the people among whom they were raised. They might later assume the names of constellations or stars, such as Orion, Polaris, or Vega. Some take on more vague names to reflect their origins, such as Nebula, Nova, or Starlight.

entries.name: Age
entries: Genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Independent and self-reliant, genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial. Primordial is a guttural language, filled with harsh syllables and hard consonants.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Radiant Resistance
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Reach for the Stars.
entries: You know the {@spell twinkle|ATLAS} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell starlight shroud|ATLAS} spell as a 2nd-level spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell dazzling gleam|ATLAS} spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Star Genasi Variant
entries: Though most star genasi are born from living stars, sometimes the situations of their birth can result in the collapse of a star into a black hole.
If your DM allows it, your star genasi character can forgo Reach for the Stars and instead gain the following feature:

entries.name: Black Hole Magic
entries: You know the {@spell twinkle|ATLAS} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell gravity pulse|ATLAS} spell as a 2nd-level spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
The ongoings on the surface interest me not. Mine eyes need look only to the heavens.

entries.name: Not so Different
entries: Cosmic gnomes live quiet and reclusive lives. The few that do encounter them often mistake them for their rock or forest counterparts, due in part from the visual similarities they share with them.

Cosmic gnomes retain some of the tinkering prowess that their rock gnome counterparts are renowned for, directing these talents toward the development of astrolabes and telescopes to further their astronomical research.

entries.name: Eyes to the Sky
entries: Cosmic gnomes are defined primarily by their intense focus toward the heavens. Utilizing their longevity, a single cosmic gnome can study and record the motion of planets and stars in the sky for hundreds of years. Their findings often spearhead developments in meteorology and astral magics.

entries.name: Seers and Scholars
entries: The depth of a cosmic gnome's knowledge grants it foresight that some find nearly magical. Many become seers or esteemed astrognomers, highly sought after as advisors by royal courts for their divinations.

entries.name: Age
entries: Cosmic gnomes enjoy relatively long lifespans compared to their forest counterparts. They mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 60. They can live 500 to almost 800 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Cosmic gnomes study the laws that govern the astral bodies, and tend towards lawful alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cosmic gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Astronomical Knowledge
entries: Whenever you make a check pertaining to the stars or other cosmic bodies, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

entries.name: Star Seer
entries: You know the {@spell guidance} cantrip. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell augury} spell as a ritual. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. You can only cast these spells outside and at night, with a clear view of the sky.

As Half-Fiends, individuals possess a unique blend of mortal and fiendish traits, granting them a range of abilities and characteristics that set them apart from other races. While each Half-Fiend is shaped by their mortal parentage and the nature of their fiendish heritage, there are certain racial traits that are common to all Half-Fiends.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your fiendish blood grants you enhanced physical and mental attributes. Increase your Charisma score by 2, reflecting your inherent charm and otherworldly presence.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Fiends mature at a rate similar to their mortal parentage, reaching adulthood in their late teens. Their infernal heritage grants them extended lifespans, allowing them to live well into their second century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The dual nature of Half-Fiends often leads them to struggle with conflicting moral compasses. While many are drawn towards darker inclinations, individual choices and personal values ultimately determine their alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Fiends possess a height and build similar to that of their mortal parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal, the language of fiends. Additionally, you can choose one extra language from the mortal parent's racial language list.

entries.name: Infernal Resistance
entries: Your fiendish lineage provides you with resistance to fire damage.

Half-fiends are the offspring of a mortal and a fiend, embodying the twisted union of two vastly different worlds. Their appearance bears both fiendish and mortal traits, such as horns, leathery wings, or even a tail. Half-Fiends possess a natural affinity for dark magic and innate demonic abilities, making them formidable enemies and intriguing player characters.

entries.name: Origins and Histories
entries: The origins of Half-Fiends can be traced back to the forbidden unions between mortals and fiends, resulting in a unique and enigmatic hybrid. The very nature of their existence embodies the clash of two disparate realms—the mortal plane and the infernal dominions. While their origins are steeped in secrecy and often shrouded in dark tales, it is believed that such unions occur when mortals, driven by their desires, form unholy pacts or succumb to the temptations of the fiendish entities.

The histories of Half-Fiends are as diverse as the multitudes of fiends that roam the planes of existence. Each individual Half-Fiend carries their own story, often marked by tragedy, struggle, or inner turmoil. Some Half-Fiends are born out of unions orchestrated by ambitious cultists seeking to bring forth powerful offspring, while others are the result of ill-fated love affairs or diabolical experiments conducted by nefarious beings.

In the annals of history, tales of Half-Fiends have emerged from all corners of the world. Legends tell of a noble knight who, in a moment of weakness, gave in to the seductions of a succubus, thus birthing a Half-Fiend heir who would eventually strive to redeem their tainted bloodline. Another story recounts a sorceress who bargained with a powerful devil, exchanging her soul for supernatural power, only to find herself pregnant with a Half-Fiend child that would grow up torn between their mortal heritage and infernal legacy.

The treatment of Half-Fiends within societies varies greatly, reflecting the prevailing beliefs and prejudices of each culture. In some realms, Half-Fiends are feared and reviled, regarded as abominations and carriers of evil. They are often driven into the shadows, forced to conceal their true nature and face a life of persecution and mistrust. Alternatively, in more cosmopolitan societies, Half-Fiends may find a semblance of acceptance, albeit with wary eyes and lingering suspicion. Here, they may attempt to carve out a place for themselves, navigating the delicate balance between their mortal upbringing and their fiendish inclinations.

Despite their tumultuous origins and often challenging paths, Half-Fiends possess inherent potential for greatness. The infusion of fiendish blood grants them unique abilities and powers, both physically and magically. Their physical traits bear the mark of their dual heritage, manifesting as horns, fangs, or darkened skin. The innate demonic abilities they possess can include the power to summon minor fiendish creatures, resist the effects of certain spells, or even unleash infernal flames upon their enemies.

entries.name: Physical Characteristics
entries: The physical characteristics of Half-Fiends bear the unmistakable marks of their dual lineage, blending the traits of mortals and fiends into a visage that is both fascinating and unsettling.
