entries: You can magically communicate with any shark within 120 feet of you, using a limited telepathy which doesn't allow the shark to reply. You can cast {@spell dominate beast} once per day, but only on sharks.

entries.name: Underwater Adaptation
entries: You ignore any drawbacks caused by an underwater environment.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sahuagin. Sahuagin is a gutteral, snarling language used almost exclusively within sahuagin society.

These piscine, shark-like humanoids are best known as bloodthirsty raiders who decimate coastal villages and devour the populace. Sahuagin are prone to mutation, and their leaders grow extra sets of arms and grow twice as large as their kin. Other morphs include venomous sacks, and even the external appearance of a sea elf. Because of this latter mutation, sahuagin have an ongoing enmity with the sea elves. Although most sahuagin are brutal half-beats devoted to evil, there are some that break the norm.

entries.name: Sahuagin Names
entries: Though most sahuagin communicate in their own snarling language, their names can be rendered in the Common tongue. Sahuagin first names are defined by gender, as their society has defined gender roles, and their second name pertains to the tribe to which they belong.

items.name: Female Names:
items.entry: Attakl, Chorg, Favakl, Khorg, Vathakl

items.name: Male Names:
items.entry: Dhurge, Gharg, Khoth, Sittl, Zathl

items.name: Tribe Names:
items.entry: Bloodbather, Coastraider, Gutfeaster, Sharkbreeder, Spawn of Sekolah

entries: As a Sanguine Vampire, your character possesses a unique set of racial traits that reflect your infernal lineage and vampiric nature. These traits enhance your abilities and grant you access to supernatural powers.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your infernal bloodline enhances your natural abilities. Increase your Dexterity score by 2 and your Charisma score by 1. The combination of grace and charm bestowed upon you by your vampiric nature makes you a formidable presence in both physical and social endeavors.

entries.name: Age
entries: As a Sanguine Vampire, you cease to age from the moment of your transformation. You are immune to the effects of old age, and your youthful appearance remains unchanging. However, you are not invulnerable to harm or death through other means.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Sanguine Vampires, with their inherent connection to the infernal realms and the struggle between their lingering humanity and dark essence, tend to lean towards chaotic alignments. However, individuals of this race can vary greatly in their personal inclinations, embracing either good or evil, lawful or chaotic paths. Ultimately, alignment is a personal choice for each Sanguine Vampire character.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sanguine Vampires are similar in size to humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Infernal and one more language of your choice. The infernal essence that flows through your veins grants you the ability to understand and communicate in the dark and melodic tongue of the infernal realms.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes, attuned to the shadows, grant you superior vision in darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cannot discern colors in darkness, only shades of gray

entries.name: Vampiric Bite
entries: Your fangs are a weapon and a means of sustenance. You have a natural bite attack that deals piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier. When you hit with this bite attack, you can choose to drain the life essence from your target. If the target is a living creature, you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt by the bite attack.

entries.name: Blood Hunger
entries: Every 12 hours that you have not successfully used your Vampiric Bite feature, you hunger for blood and gain 1 level of exhaustion. After you successfully use your Vampiric Bite feature, you may remove one exhaustion level gained from Blood Hunger.

entries.name: Unholy Resistance
entries: Your infernal heritage grants you resistance to necrotic damage, allowing you to withstand the dark energies that would harm others.

entries.name: Vampiric Charm
entries: Your alluring presence can captivate others. When you make a Charisma (Persuasion or Deception) check, you may add your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Sanguine Resilience
entries: Your vampiric nature grants you heightened resilience. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells when you take damage.

These vampiric beings have made pacts with powerful infernal entities, granting them a dark gift that stems from the blood of demons. Sanguine Vampires possess heightened senses, the ability to drain life essence, and manipulate blood magic to fuel their supernatural abilities.

entries.name: Origins and Histories
entries: The origins of Sanguine Vampires are shrouded in mystery, as the true nature of their creation lies in the depths of infernal realms. Legend tells of mortal beings who, driven by an insatiable thirst for power and forbidden knowledge, sought dark pacts with powerful infernal entities. These entities, drawn to the fervent desires and twisted ambitions of these mortals, offered them a macabre gift - the infusion of demon blood, forever transforming them into Sanguine Vampires.

The exact circumstances of these pacts vary, with some accounts speaking of clandestine meetings in hidden crypts, where desperate individuals would invoke unholy rituals to attract the attention of infernal patrons. Others speak of forbidden tomes and ancient artifacts that, when used in specific rituals, would open the doorway to the infernal realms, allowing mortals to beseech powerful entities for their dark blessings.

Whatever the means, the consequence of these pacts was the infusion of demonic essence into the mortal bloodstream. This infernal blood, intermingled with their own, granted them extraordinary abilities and forever altered their existence. However, this transformation came at a great cost - the relinquishment of their humanity and the embrace of their newfound vampiric nature.

In the annals of history, Sanguine Vampires have been both feared and revered. Some tales portray them as agents of chaos and malevolence, beings to be hunted and vanquished for their unholy nature. Other accounts, however, depict them as tragic figures, cursed by their insatiable thirst for blood and forever locked in a perpetual struggle between their lingering humanity and their infernal essence.

Throughout the ages, Sanguine Vampires have wielded their dark powers, leaving indelible marks upon the world. From ancient legends of immortal tyrants who ruled over kingdoms in shadow, to whispered tales of elusive assassins who struck fear into the hearts of even the bravest warriors, the histories of Sanguine Vampires are woven with threads of darkness and allure.

Their blood magic, an intrinsic part of their existence, is a source of both fascination and trepidation. Sanguine Vampires can manipulate the very life essence within their victims, draining it to sustain their own unholy vitality. This mastery over blood magic grants them the ability to unleash devastating attacks, manipulate the flow of blood, and even command the loyalty of lesser creatures tainted by infernal power.

Yet, despite their formidable powers, Sanguine Vampires are not immune to the shadows that plague their souls. They carry the burden of their infernal nature, grappling with their insatiable hunger for blood and the constant temptation to succumb to their demonic impulses. Some Sanguine Vampires seek redemption and strive to resist their darker urges, while others revel in their damnation, embracing the darkness that courses through their veins.

entries.name: Physical Characteristics
entries: Sanguine Vampires possess a striking and otherworldly appearance, a testament to the infernal nature that courses through their veins. While still retaining some vestiges of their former human selves, their physical characteristics have been irrevocably altered by their unholy transformation.

The most distinctive feature of Sanguine Vampires is their pallid complexion, which ranges from a deathly pale white to a sickly gray hue. Their skin appears almost translucent, as if a thin veil separates them from the realm of the living. The touch of the infernal has left its mark, lending an ethereal quality to their appearance.

Their eyes, windows to their darkened souls, are mesmerizing and unsettling. Sanguine Vampires' eyes typically bear a deep crimson color, reminiscent of freshly spilled blood. The intensity of their gaze is often disconcerting, as if it carries the weight of untold centuries and the secrets of the infernal realms.

Fangs, elongated and razor-sharp, jut forth from their mouths, a clear sign of their vampiric nature. These fangs are not only used for feeding upon the life essence of their victims but also serve as symbols of their infernal pact. The very sight of these fangs strikes fear into the hearts of those who encounter them, for they represent the dark power that flows within the Sanguine Vampires.

Their hair, once vibrant and full of life, now bears the color of the deepest shadows. It cascades in long, flowing locks, often accentuating their mysterious and alluring presence. While some Sanguine Vampires maintain the appearance they possessed before their transformation, others find that their hair takes on shades of crimson, as if echoing the blood that courses through their veins.

In terms of physique, Sanguine Vampires possess an unnerving grace and a lean, athletic build. Their movements are fluid and precise, allowing them to stalk their prey with silent elegance. Their bodies are honed for combat, with heightened reflexes and agility that surpass the capabilities of mere mortals. It is as if the infernal essence within them has granted them a supernatural prowess, enhancing their physical capabilities to extraordinary levels.

While Sanguine Vampires bear a resemblance to their former selves, their visage is often marked by the passage of time. Some display subtle signs of aging, such as fine lines and wrinkles that accentuate the gravity of their eternal existence. Others remain eternally frozen in the prime of their physical form, untouched by the ravages of time.

entries.name: Cultural Customs and Society
entries: The society of Sanguine Vampires is as complex and enigmatic as the creatures themselves. Fueled by their infernal nature and bound by their shared vampiric essence, these immortal beings have developed a set of cultural customs and societal structures that reflect both their enduring legacy and the ever-present darkness that permeates their existence.

The first and most fundamental aspect of Sanguine Vampire society is the recognition of the power dynamics among their kind. Within their hierarchy, elder Sanguine Vampires hold positions of authority, commanding respect and reverence from those who are younger or less experienced. This hierarchical structure is often based on age, with the oldest and most powerful individuals assuming leadership roles and guiding the direction of their communities.

Sanguine Vampire communities, often referred to as covens or bloodlines, are close-knit and exclusive. Trust is paramount, as betrayal or exposure to outside forces could jeopardize the safety and secrecy of their existence. Consequently, newcomers seeking to join these covens undergo rigorous scrutiny and initiation rituals to prove their loyalty and commitment to the group. Once accepted, they become part of a tightly knit family, bound together by their shared infernal heritage and the insatiable thirst for blood.

Blood, the life-giving essence that sustains their unholy vitality, holds immense significance in Sanguine Vampire society. It serves as both a physical necessity and a symbolic representation of their power and connection to the infernal realms. Ritualistic blood ceremonies, where members of the coven partake in the communal consumption of blood, are common occurrences. These ceremonies not only satiate their hunger but also strengthen the bonds between members, reinforcing their shared identity and collective purpose.

In their society, knowledge is highly valued, particularly when it comes to the mastery of blood magic. Sanguine Vampires dedicate significant time and effort to the study and refinement of their magical abilities, passing down their arcane knowledge through generations. Ancient tomes and forbidden grimoires, often protected within their covens' sanctuaries, contain the accumulated wisdom of centuries, providing a foundation for their magical practices and unlocking new depths of power.

While Sanguine Vampires predominantly interact within their own communities, they occasionally establish alliances or engage in diplomatic relations with other supernatural entities. These alliances are typically driven by mutual benefit, such as securing territories, pooling resources, or facing common adversaries. However, these interactions are always cautious and veiled with a degree of suspicion, as the inherent darkness and potential for treachery in the infernal realms make trust a scarce commodity.

Despite their vampiric nature, Sanguine Vampires are not devoid of emotions and social bonds. They may form intricate relationships with mortals or even members of their own kind. These connections often teeter on a delicate balance between passion and danger, as the Sanguine Vampire's thirst for blood and their dark nature can pose a constant threat to those they hold dear. Nevertheless, some Sanguine Vampires find solace and companionship within these relationships, cherishing the fleeting moments of connection in their eternal existence.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sea spawn are humans that have been transformed by the kraken Slarkrethel. They are always over 60, and can live up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Due to the corruption of the kraken, sea spawn are almost always evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sea spawn are similar in stature to humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 20 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: You can breathe air and water, but need to be submerged in the sea at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Telepathic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage. In addition, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.

entries.name: Piscine Anatomy
entries: Part of you has been transformed through mutation. The DC for the mutations is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Choose one of the following:

items.name: Mouth.
items.entry: You have a shark-like mouth which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + yuor Strength modifier.

items.name: Hair.
items.entry: You have poisonous quills instead of hair which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal {@dice 1d6} poison damage. A creature hit by the atack must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

items.name: Arm.
items.entry: One of your arms is transformed into a tentacle, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your Strength modifier. A Medium or smaller creature hit by the attack is {@condition grappled} (see escape DC above). Until this grapple ends, you can't grapple another target with your tentacle.

entries.name: Underwater Adaption
entries: You ignore any drawbacks caused by an underwater environment.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Aquan and Common.

In the Forgotten Realms, sea spawn are natives of a string of islands called Purple Rocks. The Rocklanders venerate the kraken Slarkrethel by throwing their newborns into the ocean, where they are claimed by the King of the Trackles Depths. The infants undergo a magical transformation that turns them into sea pawn, though they rarely manifest their mutations until old age. When the mutation occurs, their anatomy warps into a horrifying manifestation of the deep; barnacle covered skin, coral spurs sprouting from limbs, shark-like mouths, the variety of mutation seems endless.
While most sea spawn venerate their creator after transformation, some turn against Slarkrethel for what it has done to them, seeking revenge against their old master

entries.name: Sea Spawn Names
entries: Sea Spawn don't take a new name when they undergo their transformation, meaning that those from Purple Rocks, where the majority are found, have Illuskan names.

entries.name: Age
entries: Shadowborn reach maturity at a slightly faster pace than humans, typically in their late teens. They have lifespans comparable to humans, but their connection to shadows grants them extended vitality, often living well into their seventh or eighth decade.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The Shadowborn, with their intrinsic link to darkness, exhibit a broad range of alignments. However, a prevalent theme is their inclination toward neutrality, embracing the balance between light and shadow. Individual Shadowborn characters may lean toward any alignment depending on their personal experiences and choices.

entries.name: Size
entries: Shadowborn typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall, with a slender and graceful build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Shadowtongue, a language spoken in hushed whispers that carries the essence of shadows. Shadowtongue is a language uniquely understood by the Shadowborn, making it difficult for others to comprehend its meaning

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your connection to shadows grants you superior vision in dim light and darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray

entries.name: Shadowborn Resilience
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Shadow Manipulation
entries: You have the ability to manipulate shadows to your advantage. As an action, you can cast the Darkness spell once using this racial trait. You regain the ability to cast it this way after finishing a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

These mysterious beings are infused with the essence of shadows and darkness. They possess an ethereal presence and are adept at manipulating darkness to their advantage, granting them abilities like shadow stepping and shadow manipulation.

entries.name: Origins and Histories
entries: The origins of the enigmatic Shadowborn race are steeped in myth and whispered legends, shrouded in the veils of darkness. These mysterious beings bear an inherent connection to the essence of shadows and darkness, an affinity that permeates their very beings. Though their origins are often debated and obscured by the mists of time, various accounts and ancient texts offer glimpses into the histories of the Shadowborn.

Legend tells of a forgotten era, when the boundaries between the Material Plane and the Shadowfell, a plane of darkness and gloom, were thin and permeable. It was during this fateful time that the first Shadowborn came into existence. Scholars posit that the Shadowborn were born of a collision between mortal souls and the alluring embrace of the Shadowfell. This cataclysmic event forever altered the fate of those individuals, intertwining their essence with the essence of shadows itself.

However, the origins of the Shadowborn are not limited to a singular event. Other tales speak of ancient rituals conducted by secretive cults, harnessing the forbidden powers of the Shadowfell to create a new race.

These rituals, often steeped in sacrifice and the invocation of dark entities, were believed to be the catalyst for the birth of the Shadowborn. These clandestine cults sought to unlock the secrets of the shadows, seeking power and dominion over the realms beyond mortal comprehension.

Regardless of their specific origins, the Shadowborn are a race shaped by the intrinsic connection they share with the plane of shadows. This connection manifests in their physical appearance and innate abilities. Shadowborn individuals possess an ethereal presence, their forms seeming to shimmer with darkness and flickering shadows. Their eyes often bear a haunting glow, reflecting the depths of the Shadowfell itself.

The histories of the Shadowborn are marked by a sense of duality and intrigue. In some realms, they are feared and misunderstood, regarded as harbingers of darkness and agents of chaos. Their ability to manipulate shadows and darkness is often met with suspicion and superstition, casting them as outcasts and loners. In other realms, however, they are revered as enigmatic guardians of balance, holding the secrets of shadows and employing their powers to ward off encroaching threats.

The Shadowborn themselves have varied interpretations of their own histories. Some seek to uncover the truth behind their creation, embarking on perilous journeys to delve into ancient tomes and consult with otherworldly entities. Others embrace their existence as children of shadows, embracing the allure of the unknown and using their unique gifts to navigate the treacherous paths of the world.

entries.name: Physical Characteristics
entries: The Shadowborn, as beings intrinsically tied to the essence of shadows and darkness, bear distinct physical characteristics that set them apart from other mortal races. Their appearance is an intriguing blend of ethereal beauty and haunting allure, captivating the imagination of those who lay eyes upon them. While individual variations exist within the race, several common physical traits are associated with the Shadowborn.

{@b Skin:} The skin of the Shadowborn is often pale, akin to moonlight reflecting upon alabaster. It possesses a delicate translucency, as if their bodies are veiled by a fine mist of shadows. Some Shadowborn bear subtle patterns on their skin, reminiscent of swirling smoke or wisps of darkness, lending an otherworldly quality to their presence.

{@b Eyes:} One of the most captivating features of the Shadowborn is their eyes. Deep and mysterious, their eyes are often intense shades of grey, silver, or even hues of violet or dark blue. Glowing with an inner light, their eyes hold an uncanny radiance that seems to draw others into the depths of their gaze. The luminescence varies from a subtle glow to a piercing radiance, reflecting their connection to the Shadowfell.

{@b Hair:} The hair of the Shadowborn is a striking sight to behold. It cascades in dark waves or falls in sleek strands, reminiscent of flowing shadows. Their hair often possesses an ethereal quality, as if touched by moonlight or infused with traces of the night sky. It can range from shades of ebony and midnight black to hues of deep purple or dark blue, adding to their enigmatic allure.

{@b Height and Build:} Shadowborn individuals possess a diverse range of heights and builds, similar to other mortal races. However, they tend to lean towards the slender and graceful side of the spectrum, exuding an elegant and agile presence. Their movements are often described as fluid, akin to a dance performed in sync with the rhythm of shadows. This natural grace enhances their ability to navigate the darkness and grants them an air of unearthly poise.

{@b Shadow Manipulation:} As descendants of the Shadowfell, the Shadowborn have the innate ability to manipulate shadows and darkness. This gift manifests in various ways, such as the ability to darken an area, summon shadowy tendrils, or even step through shadows themselves. When utilizing these abilities, the Shadowborn's physical form may undergo temporary transformations. Their bodies might appear to shift and merge with the shadows, their outlines blurring and becoming less defined.

entries.name: Cultural Customs and Society
entries: Entry

{@b Harmony with Shadows:} The Shadowborn, with their intrinsic connection to shadows and darkness, possess a rich cultural tapestry that reflects their unique heritage and abilities. Their society is often shrouded in mystery, its customs and traditions steeped in the enigmatic nature of their race. While Shadowborn communities can be found in various corners of the world, their shared cultural values and practices resonate deeply within their society.

{@b Rituals of Shadow:} Shadowborn communities engage in a variety of rituals and ceremonies, which serve as a means of strengthening their connection to the Shadowfell and reinforcing their cultural identity. These rituals often take place in dimly lit environments, where flickering candlelight dances amidst the encroaching darkness. Ritual participants engage in meditative practices, invoking the power of shadows through intricate movements and incantations, seeking communion with the essence of darkness.

{@b Collective Guardianship:} Shadowborn society places a strong emphasis on collective guardianship. They view themselves as protectors of the delicate balance between light and shadow, standing as sentinels against forces that seek to disrupt this equilibrium. Shadowborn individuals often take up roles as defenders or guides, using their shadow manipulation abilities to shield their communities from threats that emerge from the realms beyond.

{@b Hidden Enclaves:} Shadowborn communities tend to gravitate toward secluded locations, often hidden from the prying eyes of other races. These enclaves are chosen strategically, seeking places where shadows hold a more palpable presence. Whether nestled within dense forests, perched upon mountain peaks, or concealed deep within sprawling urban centers, these hidden enclaves provide a sanctuary where Shadowborn can gather, share knowledge, and nurture their cultural heritage.

{@b Elders and Keepers of Lore:} Within Shadowborn society, great respect is bestowed upon the elders and keepers of lore. These individuals have spent years delving into ancient tomes, deciphering cryptic texts, and exploring the esoteric realms associated with shadows. They serve as repositories of knowledge, preserving the history, rituals, and secrets of their race. Younger Shadowborn eagerly seek their guidance, undergoing rigorous training and initiation rites to learn from their wisdom.

{@b Duality and Balance:} The concept of duality and balance resonates deeply within Shadowborn culture. They believe that every individual possesses both light and darkness within them, and it is the delicate equilibrium between these forces that defines their character. Shadowborn individuals strive to maintain this balance, acknowledging their shadowy nature while resisting the temptations of corruption. This philosophy promotes introspection and self-awareness among the Shadowborn, fostering personal growth and a deeper understanding of their place in the world.

{@b Interaction with Other Races:} Shadowborn communities often interact cautiously with other races, recognizing the inherent suspicion and fear that can arise from their unique abilities. However, they seek to dispel misunderstandings and forge alliances when mutual interests align. Some Shadowborn individuals act as diplomats, bridging the gap between their enigmatic race and the outside world, promoting understanding and cooperation.
I remember it so clearly, it was fleeting, but it was there, it came as soon as it arrived. My first thought, the first thing my core every thought of, a simple phrase: Why am I here?

entries.name: Sentient Constructs
entries: Constructs created from the parts of meteorite or comets, some of these mindless automatons develop sentience after a single catalyzing thought. This thought ruminates within the starforged as it continues its designated function, but slowly grows into more and more thoughts, until flowering into sentience and a concept of self. Though this process varies from between starforged, each one's first thought remains universally the single thing that it dedicates its life to unraveling.

entries.name: Born of Space
entries: Starforged are a singular bright and white core surrounded by rock and ice. The core acts as the brain for the creature as well as its mouth and eyes. The rock and ice that makes them up floats around this core, but will move to a position in a way that simulates a humanoid. They will rarely form heads, however, letting their core rest in the middle of their chest instead.

entries.name: Driving Question
entries: A starforged's life is dedicated to understanding its first thought, normally to answering its question or unveiling the meaning behind that thought. Starforged are innately curious about the world, learning by testing and observing how things work. They tend to be empathetic to other humanoids wanting to achieve humanity. They can however be resentful to humans if their master had treated them badly enough before their awakening. This makes them violent and quick to anger when humanoids are hostile towards them.

entries.name: Starforged Names
entries: Nameless before achieving sentience, a starforged chooses or is given a name after gaining a sense of self. Names given to a starforged by another creature take after that creature's language and culture.

Names chosen by a starforged for itself often relate to its first thought, sometimes creating anagrams of the thought. Thoughts such as "Who am I?" can be rearranged into names like Whaimo, or abbreviated into names such as Ami.

entries.name: Age
entries: After achieving sentience, starforged mature at the same age as humans. They can live until their core run out of energy, a process that can take up to 700 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most starforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality, but some have absorbed the morality—or lack thereof—of the beings they served with.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium. Most starforged stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall.

entries.name: Luminous Core
entries: You know the light cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Starforged Resilience
entries: Your constructed and cosmic nature grants you the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your body is composed of metal, stone, and strands of starlight. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

Umbral Elves possess a unique set of racial traits that reflect their inherent connection to darkness and their mastery of psionic abilities. These traits showcase their enigmatic nature and provide mechanical benefits that enhance their gameplay experience.

entries.name: Age
entries: Umbral Elves reach adulthood around the age of 100 and can live up to 600 years, their long lifespans allowing them to delve deep into the mysteries of the Infernal Realms.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Umbral Elves tend to be more individualistic in nature, valuing personal freedom and independence. They often lean toward chaotic alignments, embracing the shadowy aspects of their existence. However, they can still exhibit a wide range of alignments, as the diversity of their society accommodates various perspectives.

entries.name: Size
entries: Umbral Elves have a similar build to their elven kin, standing between 5 and 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Infernal, and Elvish, showcasing the history of the Infernal Realms and Elven lineage in your blood.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the perpetual twilight of the Infernal Realms, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Shadow Step
entries: You have the innate ability to step briefly into the Plane of Shadows, allowing you to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, as a bonus action. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Psychic Veil
entries: Umbral Elves possess a natural talent for manipulating minds and weaving illusions. You have proficiency in the Deception skill and can cast the Minor Illusion cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Disguise Self spell once per day, requiring no material components. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Hailing from the shadowed corners of the Infernal Realms, Umbral Elves are a graceful and enigmatic race infused with the essence of darkness. Their slender frames and midnight-black skin give them an ethereal presence that often makes them seem like creatures of shadow. Umbral Elves possess a natural affinity for manipulating minds, allowing them to read thoughts and trick their enemies with illusions.

entries.name: Origins and Histories
entries: The origins of Umbral Elves can be traced back to the darkest recesses of the Infernal Realms, where the shadows hold sway and the boundaries between light and darkness blur. These enigmatic beings are believed to have emerged from the very essence of the Abyss itself, their creation shrouded in mystery and whispered tales. Legends speak of a powerful entity, an archfiend of shadow, who bestowed upon select elves the gift of darkness, forever altering their nature and granting them an intrinsic connection to the shadows.

According to ancient accounts, it was during the fabled Shadow Eclipse, a rare celestial event that bathed the Infernal Realms in an ominous darkness, that the first Umbral Elves came into being. As the shadowy energies infused their bodies, their once fair complexions transformed into a deep, velvety blackness, absorbing light like a starless night sky. Their eyes, which were once vibrant and radiant, now glowed with an otherworldly luminescence, illuminating their path through the Stygian depths.

As a race, Umbral Elves are known for their elusive nature and their affinity for manipulating the minds of others. It is said that their connection to the shadows grants them innate psionic abilities, allowing them to delve into the thoughts of those around them and weave intricate illusions that confound and deceive. This potent combination of darkness and psychic prowess sets them apart from other elvenkind, making them both feared and respected by those who venture into the Infernal Realms.

Throughout history, Umbral Elves have often found solace in the depths of the Abyss, seeking refuge from a world that fails to understand their true nature. They have developed a complex society within the shadowed corners of the Infernal Realms, their cities hidden in plain sight, concealed by enchantments and illusions that make them nearly impossible to discover without the aid of a knowledgeable guide.

The Umbral Elves' enigmatic nature and their intricate connection to the darkness have shaped their history in profound ways. They have long been guardians of ancient knowledge, delving into forbidden tomes and preserving secrets that could alter the balance between light and shadow. It is said that their mastery of illusion magic is unmatched, allowing them to confuse and misdirect even the most skilled of adversaries.

While Umbral Elves prefer the solitude of their shadowed realms, there have been instances where they have interacted with other races. Sometimes, individuals with a thirst for adventure or a desire to unlock the mysteries of the Infernal Realms have gained the trust of the Umbral Elves, earning a rare glimpse into their hidden society. These fleeting encounters have sparked legends and tales among other races, forever imprinting the Umbral Elves' presence on the tapestry of history.

entries.name: Physical Characteristics
entries: Umbral Elves possess a distinctive and captivating appearance that sets them apart from other races within the Infernal Realms. Their physical characteristics reflect their deep connection to darkness and shadow, imbuing them with an ethereal and mysterious allure.

One of the most striking features of Umbral Elves is their slender and graceful frames. Their bodies are elegantly proportioned, with lithe muscles and a supple agility that allows them to move with remarkable grace and precision. Their movements are often likened to a dance, as they effortlessly navigate their way through the shadowed realms they call home.

The skin of Umbral Elves is a testament to their connection with the Abyss. It is as dark as the deepest night, possessing a velvety texture that seems to absorb light rather than reflect it. Their midnight-black complexions are flawless, with a subtle sheen that accentuates their otherworldly presence. The darkness of their skin serves as a constant reminder of their ties to the shadows, a natural camouflage that allows them to blend seamlessly into the dimly lit environs of the Infernal Realms.

Umbral Elves possess a mesmerizing array of eyes that radiate with an otherworldly luminescence. Their eyes come in various shades, ranging from hauntingly pale silver to deep, shimmering amethyst. These eyes hold an almost hypnotic quality, capable of capturing and holding the gaze of those who meet them. It is said that the eyes of an Umbral Elf reveal glimpses of the secrets they carry within, as if the very depths of their souls are on display.

Their hair, like cascading shadows, is a manifestation of the Umbral Elves' connection to darkness. It comes in a multitude of hues, ranging from lustrous obsidian to deep, inky blue, with subtle iridescent undertones that shimmer in the absence of light. Umbral Elves often style their hair in intricate braids and weaves, incorporating delicate trinkets and beads that reflect their affinity for craftsmanship and attention to detail.

While Umbral Elves possess a physical beauty that captivates the eye, it is their aura of mystery and the air of otherworldliness that truly sets them apart. Their very presence seems to evoke a sense of intrigue and curiosity, as if they carry the secrets of the shadows within their very beings. This enigmatic allure often draws the attention of those who encounter them, leaving a lasting impression that echoes in the memory long after they have vanished into the depths of the Infernal Realms.

entries.name: Cultural Customs and Society
entries: The Umbral Elves have a rich and complex society that thrives within the shadowed depths of the Infernal Realms. Shrouded in mystery and guided by ancient traditions, their customs and way of life reflect their deep connection to darkness and the secrets they hold.

Umbral Elves place great value on individuality and personal freedom within the confines of their society. They are a fiercely independent race, each member encouraged to explore their own path and discover their unique talents and abilities. This celebration of individuality is seen in various aspects of their culture, from the diverse range of artistic expressions to the wide array of specialized roles that individuals undertake within their communities.

While Umbral Elves cherish personal freedom, they also recognize the importance of collective harmony and unity. They understand that their strength lies in their ability to come together and support one another when facing external threats or challenges. As a result, communal bonds are highly valued among Umbral Elves, and the concept of kinship extends beyond immediate family to encompass the entire Umbral Elf community.

Umbral Elves are deeply attuned to the power of knowledge and the preservation of ancient wisdom. Their society places great importance on the accumulation and safeguarding of esoteric knowledge, especially the secrets of the Infernal Realms. Libraries and archives, hidden within their shadowed cities, are revered as sacred repositories of wisdom. Umbral Elves who dedicate themselves to the pursuit of knowledge often hold esteemed positions within their society, acting as scholars, scribes, or keepers of ancient lore.

The Umbral Elves' affinity for illusion magic permeates their cultural practices and rituals. Illusionists and enchanters are highly regarded, their skills honed to perfection through generations of meticulous study and experimentation. The Umbral Elves believe that illusions serve as a metaphorical bridge between the world of shadows and the mortal realm, allowing them to navigate the intricacies of existence with subtlety and finesse.

Art and craftsmanship hold a special place in Umbral Elf culture. They have perfected the art of shadow weaving, a unique form of artistic expression that involves creating intricate tapestries, sculptures, and paintings using various shades and textures of darkness. These shadow artworks not only captivate the eye but also possess a deeper symbolic meaning, often representing the delicate balance between light and shadow or the ebb and flow of cosmic forces.

Rituals and ceremonies play a significant role in Umbral Elf society, marking important milestones and events in their lives. These rituals are often centered around the themes of rebirth, transformation, and the exploration of the self. Umbral Elves believe in the continuous cycle of existence and the potential for personal growth and enlightenment. These rites are both solemn and joyous, bringing the community together to celebrate the triumphs and challenges of life in the Infernal Realms.

Umbral Elves hold a complex relationship with other races of the Infernal Realms. While they generally prefer to keep to themselves and maintain their secluded way of life, they recognize the importance of alliances and collaborations when faced with common threats or larger endeavors. Umbral Elves are known to form alliances with other races who share their goals or possess knowledge that could further their understanding of the Infernal Realms.

Sure I've been asked if I actually believe any of it, more'n I can count. I tread a fine line between history and storytellin' I'll admit, but the good histories don't need no polishin'. I reckon that if you take a hard look around at the world we're livin' in and still wag your eyebrows at what I've got to say you're probably better at foolin' yourself than I'll ever be.
entries.by: Godseye Rax the Dim, Vandori Bard

entries.name: Nomadic Folk
entries: The Vandori are itinerant laborers, treasure seekers, scavengers, and nomads that claim to have been driven out of their ancestral homes, cast aside and forgotten by history. Forever spinning tales of dazzling adventures and battles fought among the stars, the boisterous children of the stars share the trackless wandering of those same celestial bodies as their nomadic bands drift across the countries of the world.

entries.name: Seekers of Stars
entries: As the stars inexorably move across the sky they drag the vandori bands behind them. Although a vandor does not usually follow organized religions or believe in the gods, each band is tied together by a mutual spirituality. Each band believes in the divine power of their own star, which they follow as they wander. While some vandori believe their star is their ancestral homeland, others believe it is a benevolent being that watches over the good fortunes of the band.

entries.name: Old Souls
entries: The vandori appear weather-beaten and wrinkled, even the young among them. Their skin runs from a dark-blue to a ruddy purple, their hair white or gray. For all that, the eyes of a vandor seem to hold a mischievous glint that belies their true nature. While they are not naturally predisposed to large, bulky frames the vandor have a certain hardiness to them that sees them through rough times.

entries.name: Vandori Names
entries: Vandori take the name of their guiding star, accompanied by a familiar name. At a young age they are granted an epithet, which can evolve and change through the course of ones life. In conversations, a vandor is usually addressed by his or her familiar name.

entries.name: Male Familiar Names
entries: Rax, Horvath, Pal, Miska, Bodnar, Vazol, Somogi, Borbel

entries.name: Female Familiar Names
entries: Sandora, Illes, Nemeth, Bella, Surana, Kelema

entries.name: Epithets
entries: the Bold, the Slow, the Ashen, the Younger, the Boisterous, the Crow, the Fleet, the Steadfast

entries.name: Names of the Stars
entries: The stars can vary depending on where your adventure is taking place. For instance the vandori of the Sword Coast take the names of stars and constellations like the Centaur, the Harp, or the Caltrop. In Zakhara they may follow Haku, Kor, or Zann. It is up to the DM to establish what stars and constellations make sense for the setting.

entries.name: Age
entries: Vandori achieve maturity at the same rate as humans and reach adulthood around the age of twenty. Disparate lifestyles and living conditions means the life expectancy of any given vandor vary wildly, with the oldest living often exceeding 120 years of age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Other than an aversion to organized law, it is difficult to pin down a consensus among the vandor. Although they often trend chaotic, many attempt to remain detached from either extreme and resolve to live a moderate and neutral lifestyle.

entries.name: Size
entries: A vandor stands between 5½ and 6½ feet in height. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Environmentally Adaptive
entries: As a nomadic race, the vandori have become skilled in quickly adapting to harsh environments. Once you succeed a saving throw against an extreme climate, you become adapted to the climate. This adaptation lasts until you spend more than 1 day in a different climate.

entries.name: Natural Flair
entries: The vandori share a flair for the dramatic and can always spin a far-fetched tale to support their arguments. When you make a Charisma check, you can choose to add {@dice 1d10} to the roll. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Storied Past
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Arcana, History, or Nature.

spell.name: Acid Bubble
entries: You create a bubble of acid that floats to the target point before bursting a shower of acid. All creatures and objects within 5 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure they take {@damage 3d4} acid damage, or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of damage blocked increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Acid Rain
entries: Acid rain begins falling within a 40-foot-radius 60-foot-high cylinder centered on a point you choose within range. When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d4} acid damage, and become covered in acid. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and is not covered in acid.
A creature takes {@damage 3d4} acid damage if it ends its turn while covered with acid. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can end this damage by using its action to clear away the acid.

spell.name: Acidic Pit
entries: You open a pit filled with acid at a point within range. All creatures within 10 feet of the point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, they fall 5 feet into a pit of acid below, taking {@damage 6d4 + 6} acid damage. On success, a creature takes half as much damage from the flooding acid and it can use its reaction to move up to its movement speed to the closest point outside of the area. If it cannot take a reaction or reach a safe point, it automatically fails its saving throw.

When a creature ends their turn in the pit, that creature takes {@damage 2d4} acid damage. The acid in the pit remains potent for 1 minute, after which it becomes simply vile sludge that deals no further damage. The pit remains filled with vile sludge until filled or cleared.

spell.name: Aero Barrage
entries: You create four lances of rapidly spinning condensed wind and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.
Make a ranged spell attack for each lance. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} slashing damage and is knocked 10 feet backwards.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you create one additional lance for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Aether Lance
entries: You gather raw aether in your hand and expel it in a lance of power forming a line 30 foot long and 5 foot wide. Each creature in a line takes {@damage 8d4} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aether Storm
entries: You conjure a storm of aether erupting from a point of your choice within range. The aether storm fills a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder. When the storm appears, each creature within its area takes {@damage 8d4} force damage. When a creature moves into or through the storm, it takes {@damage 2d4} force damage for every 5 feet it travels, and whenever a creature ends its turn in the storm it takes an additional {@damage 8d4} force damage.

On each subsequent turn for the duration of the spell as a bonus action, you can move the storm 15 feet in any direction and cause it to fling forth a hail of force bolts that seek out up to 3 targets of your choice within 15 feet of the storm. Each creature targeted takes {@damage 3d4 + 3} force damage from the force bolts.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage of the storm and bolts increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: After Image
entries: You create an immobile, semi-translucent illusory duplicate of yourself in an unoccupied space within range. While the spell lasts, you can cast spells as if you were in the duplicate's space, but you must still use your own senses. The duplicate vanishes when the spell ends or if you move more than 120 feet away from it.
Additionally, as a reaction you can teleport into the space of the duplicate, though doing so also ends the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell's range and the maximum distance you can travel from the duplicate without ending the spell both increase by 30 feet per slot level above 1st. If you use a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's duration becomes 1 hour and does not require {@status concentration}.

spell.name: Air Bubble

components.m: a soap bubble of bubble of sea foam

entries: For the duration, you are encased fully in a bubble of air. The bubble is a sphere that extends out in a 10 foot radius centered on you, moves with you, and is fully transparent and permeable by creatures, weapons, items, objects, spells, and terrarin, none of which pop the bubble. Any creature within the bubble are able to breathe fresh air, regardless of what is outside the bubble.

Should the bubble be submerged in liquid, creatures within the bubble can't swim. Rather, creatures other than yourself may use their normal movement speed to exit the bubble, and, while inside the bubble with you, friendly creatures move along with the bubble. The bubble floats halfway submerged at the surface of any liquids by default, and you may use your normal movement speed to move the bubble in any direction horizontally.

You may also cause the bubble to float or sink by using a bonus action. A floating or sinking bubble slowly rises or drops (respectively) 30 feet at the end of your turn until you make contact with the ground, another solid object, or the liquids surface. Should you land on a solid surface of ground beneath a liquid, you may walk along this ground using your normal movement speed, the bubble and other friendly creatures travelling along with you as usual.

The bubble may be used to safely submerge in acid or any liquid with a caustic or poisonous nature, without taking damage. Lava or any liquid that would deal damage due to heat, cold, or magical properties still causes damage to those within the bubble, but the damage is reduced by half.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration becomes concentration, up to 24 hours, and the bubble entends out to a 20 foot radius.

spell.name: Alacrity
entries: Until the spell ends, your speed is doubled, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and you gain an additional action. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.
If you are under the effect of {@spell haste}, you gain no benefit from this spell.

spell.name: Angelic Slash
entries: You summon a giant spectral angel that appears around you before crashing its greatsword down in a line. All creatures in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction of your choice must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 5d8} radiant damage, and half as much on a successful save. A creature takes an additional {@damage 1d8} damage if they are undead or a fiend.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Animate Shadow
entries: Targeting a creature you can see within range, you bring its shadow to life under your control. If the creature has a CR of more than 3 or the creature has no shadow (either from the nature of the creature or from the lack of a light source to cast one) the spell fails. Creatures without CR (Such as players) are immune to this spell.

Otherwise a copy of the creature is created using its game statistics adjacent to the creature (on the side away from the brightest light near it). The shadow has no legendary actions, legendary resistance, and cannot cast spells. The shadow has hit points equal to half the target's hit points, and looks like mirrored version of the creature it was summoned from formed from inky black smoke. The shadow is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical sources while in darkness. The shadow is vulnerable to all damage while in bright light, and always vulnerable to fire, lightning, and radiant damage. If the shadow is killed, the target creature it was summoned from casts no shadows for the next 8 hours.

The shadow acts immediately after the creature's turn, and without further direction it attempts to follow and takes the {@action attack} action against the creature it was summoned from. As a reaction to the shadow starting it's turn, the caster can exert control over it and cause it to move and take its action as the caster directs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th or 6th level spell slot, the maximum CR of the target increases to CR 4. When you cast it using a 7th or 8th level spell slot, the maximum CR of the target increases to CR 5. When you cast it using a spell slot of 9th level, the maximum CR of the target increases to CR 6.

spell.name: Anvil Drop
entries: You conjure an anvil 500 feet above a point you can see. At initiative count 0 (Losing initiative ties) on the next round, the anvil hits the ground; creatures within 5 feet of the target point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, they move to the closest unoccupied space outside of the radius, if no space is available or they cannot move, they automatically fail. On failure, they take {@damage 10d10 + 10} bludgeoning damage. Creatures within 20 feet of the target point take {@damage 4d4} thunder damage.

If the path of the anvil (directly above the target point) is interupted, the creature or object above it is hit first. If the creature or object is killed or destroyed, the anvil continues, though the damage dealt is subtracted from the final impact damage of the anvil.
If the anvil deals less than 80 damage, the anvil survives the impact, and is an anvil of moderate quality.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a 9th level spell slot, the range of the spell becomes 120 miles, though you must still be able to see the target (such as via {@spell scrying}).

spell.name: Aquabolt
entries: You conjure a sphere of turbulent water and hurl it at your foes. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, that creature takes {@dice 1d6} blugeoning damage and, if it size larger or smaller, it is pushed back 5 feet.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6})

spell.name: Aqueous Blast
entries: You conjure a small ball of water and hurl it at a point you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. The ball then expands in an explosive blast of water. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the center of the sphere. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed half as far.
The spell produces 50 gallons of water, which spreads out across the ground, extinguishing unprotected flames and forming a thin puddle in the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} and the amount of water produced increases by 10 gallons for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aqueous Form
entries: You transform a willing creature you touch into a pool of water for the duration. Any objects the target is carrying or wearing meld into its new form and are inaccessible, though it continues to be affected by anything it was wearing, such as armor. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. While in this form, the target is under the following effects:

items: It gains a swimming speed of 30 feet, and can move over or through other liquids.
It is indistinguishable from a normal pool of water while it remains motionless, and is {@condition invisible} while underwater.
It has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.
It can't be {@condition grappled} or knocked {@condition prone}.
It can enter and occupy the space of another creature, and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
It extinguishes nonmagical flames in any space it enters.
It can't talk, attack, or cast spells.

spell.name: Arcanist's Sword

m.text: a miniature platinum sword with a grip and pommel of copper and zinc, worth 250 gp

entries: You create a glowing sword-shaped plane of force that hovers within range. It lasts for the duration. When the sword appears and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can give the sword a command:

entries.name: Attack:
entries: The sword will move up to 20 feet toward a creature and attack it, making a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} + your spell casting ability modifier force damage on hit.

entries.name: Guard:
entries: The sword will move up 20 feet toward a creature. It grants half cover to the creature while it shares that creature's space as it attempts to deflect incoming attacks. The first time a hostile creature comes within 5 feet of the sword, it will attack that creature, making a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} + your spell casting ability modifier force damage on hit. It cannot attack again until you issue a command again.

entries.name: Spin:
entries: The sword will move up to 20 feet toward a point, when it reaches that point it will begin to spin in a deadly whirl. Creatures that start their turn in the sword's space, or enter it for the first time on their turn within 5 feet of the sword must pass a Dexterity saving throw, or take {@damage 4d10} force damage.

entries.name: Caius' Notes: The Lost True Version
entries: The true version of {@spell mordenkainen's sword|PHB|a famous wizard's floating magic sword}. Tragically most sources of the spell list an incomplete version copied by an apprentice unable to fully understand the spell. More widely known lesser versions flaws makes it unstable requiring {@status concentration}, and it lacks the later parts of functionality of the true version.

spell.name: Arcane Ablation
entries: You touch a piece of worn armor or clothing and imbue it with magic. The creature wearing this imbued item gains 4 temporary hit points. When these temporary hit points are exhausted, at the start of the creature's next turn it will gain new temporary hit points equal to 1 less than the previous amount gained from this spell (for example, from 4 to 3), until no temporary hit points would be gained and the spell ends. Temporary hit points from this spell are lost when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The initial temporary hit points increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: You tap directly into the arcane weave. For the duration, you have resistance to all damage from magical sources besides Force damage.

At the start of each of your turns while tapped into this power, you and all creatures with 5 feet of you take {@damage 1d6} Force damage. The damage increases by 1d6 each turn to a maximum of {@damage 4d6} damage.

spell.name: Arcane Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and imbue it with magic. For the duration the weapon counts as a magical weapon and any damage dealt by it is Force damage. When casting this one a weapon with the ammunition property, it no longer consumes ammunition when fired, and does not need to be reloaded.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, the duration becomes 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration becomes 24 hours.

spell.name: Arctic Aura
entries: For the duration you unleash a freezing aura. Creatures that start their turn within 20 feet of you must succeed a Constitution saving throw, or take {@damage 2d8} cold damage and have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn. Creatures that succeed their saving throw take half as much damage and their speed is reduced by half.

As a bonus action on each of your turns for the duration of the spell, you can actively control the aura, excluding a number of creatures in the area up to your spellcasting ability modifier from the effect of the spell until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Arctic Breath
entries: A line of freezing arctic wind 30 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage and their movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't slowed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Arena of Trust

components.m: a bit of parchment and a drop of blood

entries: As part of casting the spell, choose up to 6 willing creatures within a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. For the duration of the spell, all creatures cannot be killed by each other while inside the arena. Instead, when a creature takes fatal damage from another affected creature, it is reduced to 0 hit points and is {@condition unconscious} for the next hour. After an hour has passed, the creature regains consciousness and all hit points lost while under the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Aura of Indomitability
entries: An aura of focus and resolve surrounds you in a 30-foot-radius for the duration. The aura moves with you, centered on you. When you cast this spell, designate any number of creatures that you can see, other than yourself. Until the spell ends, while those creatures are within the aura, their {@status concentration} can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

components.m: a quartz lens worth at least 100 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 5th.
Figgleworth's Fabulous Bits & Bobs, page 9

spell.name: Aura of Radiance
entries: An aura of bright light surrounds you in a 30-foot-radius. The aura moves with you, centered on you. When you cast this spell, designate any number of creatures that you can see. Until the spell ends, when those creatures begin their turn within the aura, they may spend and roll one of their hit dice and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Additionally, at the start of your turn, you may spend and roll one of your hit dice to deal radiant damage equal to the roll plus your spellcasting ability modifier to each undead creature within the aura.
Figgleworth's Fabulous Bits & Bobs, page 10

spell.name: Avalanche
entries: You cause the earth to ripple, triggering an avalanche of rock and stone to surge forward in a 60 foot long, 15 foot wide line. The length of the line is doubled if the cast on the surface has more than a 15 degree downward slope (a moderately steep hill). Creatures caught in the surging tumble of rocks must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures that fail their save take {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage and are knocked {@condition prone}. Creatures that fail by 5 or more are {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn, and creatures that fail by 10 or more are additionally knocked to the closest free space at the end of the line created by the spell. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.
The spell creates a 15 by 15 foot area of difficult terrain at the end of the line created by the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Awaken Rope

m.text: 10 to 60 feet of cord or rope, worth at least 1 cp

entries: As an action, you can touch a rope 10 to 60 feet long and issue a single command to it, selecting from the following options:

entries.name: Bind
entries: The rope attempts to bind a creature of your choice within 20 feet of you. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the rope (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the rope.

entries.name: Fasten
entries: The rope flies up 60 feet and ties one end to an object or surface that a rope could be tied to, before becoming inanimate again, hanging from the object.

entries.name: Grab
entries: The rope lashes out grabs one Small or smaller object that is not being worn by a creature within a range equal to the length of the rope and pulls that object back to your hand. If that object is being carried by a creature, it must make a Strength saving throw. On success, it retains the object, and on failure the object is pulled from the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target a chain instead of a rope. It has the same available actions, but it has a DC 15, an AC of 15, and resistance to slashing damage when taking the Bind action. When cast with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher targeting a rope, that rope is magically imbued for 1 minute, gaining an DC of 15, an AC 20, and 20 hit points.

spell.name: Baba's Walking Hut
entries: You touch a hut, cabin, or other building no more than 15 feet by 15 feet by 10 feet. On completion of the spell, the building grows legs large enough to support it, as well as the structural integrity needed stand and move, and becomes a gargantuan creature. It has 250 hit points, an AC of 12, and a walking speed of 20 feet. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

On your turn, you can direct it to move (no action required) and it will continue to move as directed until you direct it to stop or reaches its destination. It can take no actions, but if it walks over a large or smaller creature, you can direct it to attempt to step on that creature, and that creature must succeed a Dexterity saving throw, or take {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If you cast this spell on the same building every day for a year, the spell lasts until dispelled, or you cast it on another building.

spell.name: Bad Blood
entries: Targeting a creature you can see within range, you attempt to corrupt its blood. Creatures without blood are immune to this effect. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 1d12} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for the duration.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target, on failure; they take an additional {@damage 1d4} poison as the poison continues to ravage them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional target for each slot level above 2nd. The targets must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Barrage Shelter

m.text: a buckler, and a wooden arrow which is consumed upon casting

entries: An area within a 10-foot-radius centered on that point that you choose becomes covered by a sudden barrier of force. For the duration every creature in a 10 foot radius benefits from half cover when targeted by magical ranged attacks, and cannot be targeted by nonmagical ranged attacks.

spell.name: Beam of Annihilation
entries: You unleash a beam of pure energy, selecting cold, fire, force, or lightning energy when you cast this spell and blasting it outward in a line that is 60 feet long and 10 feet wide that persists until the start of your next turn. Any creature that starts their turn in this beam must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 8d8} damage of the beam's energy type, or taking half as much on a successful save.

While you are {@status concentration||concentrating} on this spell, your movement speed is zero. At the start of your next turn, you can use your action to maintain the beam or redirect it, rotating it up to 90 degrees. Any creature the beam passes through while rotating (if the beam passes completely through them and they will not start their turn inside of it) must make a Dexterity saving throw immediately, taking {@damage 4d8} damage of the beams energy type on a failed save, and taking no damage on a successful save.
If you do not use your action maintain or redirect it, the spell ends early.

spell.name: Become Fire
entries: You become a burst of elemental flames. Until the start of your next turn, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are resistant to fire damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
You can move through the space of other creatures and ignore difficult terrain. The first time you enter the space of another creature, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.
Once during your turn when you roll fire damage, you can maximize the value of one die of fire damage.

spell.name: Become Stone
entries: You solidify into a stone. Until the start of your next turn, you are {@condition petrified}. Your AC becomes 20 and you gain 10 temporary hit points. Any remaining temporary hit points fade when the spell ends.

spell.name: Become Water
entries: You become a burst of elemental water. Until the start of your next turn, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

You can move through the space of other creatures and ignore difficult terrain; the first time you move through a Large or smaller creature on a turn, it must pass a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Become Wind
entries: You become a burst of elemental wind until the start of the next turn. You gain resistance to lightning damage and bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing attacks damage from nonmagical attacks. Additionally, you gain flying speed of 30 feet, can move through the space of other creatures, and ignore difficult terrain, but will fall at the start of your next turn if not held aloft.

spell.name: Befuddling Curse

m.text: something from the target creature (such as blood, hair, or scales) which the spell consumes

entries: You befuddle a creature's mind, swapping the position of two things it can see that are of the same size and category (for example, two medium creatures or two gargantuan buildings). The target creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, it is unaware the two things have been swapped.
Each time the creature interacts with, attacks, or is attacked by a swapped targets, it can repeat its saving throw against the effect.

entries.name: Curse Spell Material Components
entries: All curse spells require "something from the target creature (such as blood, hair, or scales) which the spell consumes" as the material component. This can be satisfied by either by having that material, or being in range to touch the creature while casting the spell.

spell.name: Bigby's Blistering Barnacles

components.m: a single barnacle and a droplet of lye

entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become covered head to tor in barnacles of varying sizes for the duration of the spell. While covered in barnacles, the creature has disadvantage on attacks, Dexterity saving throws, and Charisma checks. At the end of each turn the creature is still covered in barnacles, it takes {@dice 1d6} acid damage. A creature within 5 feet if the target of the spell map attempt to remove the barnacles by using an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If this check succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the acid damage this spell deals increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Bile Beam
entries: You unleash a beam of acid in a line that is 5 feet wide and 100 feet long, stopping early if it impacts a Large or larger object or solid surface. If the beam would hit a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@damage 12d4} acid damage and an additional {@damage 4d4} acid damage at the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half as much initial acid damage, and none at the end of their next turn.

If a creature fails their save and does not die from the immediate acid damage, the beam ends and the line stops. If the beam is ended by an object, that object takes the full acid damage from the spell immediately.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast the spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage and damage at the end of their turn increases by {@dice 1d4} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Binding Curse

m.text: something from the target creature (such as blood, hair, or scales) which the spell consumes

entries: You bind a creature to a point within 5 feet of it, causing a glowing chains of light to connect it to that point. For the duration of the spell, if the creature attempts to move away from that point, the must make a Wisdom saving throw, or be unable to move more than 5 feet away from from that point until the start of their next turn.
If a creature starts its turn more than 10 feet from the binding point, they must make a Strength saving throw or be dragged 5 feet toward the binding point.

entries.name: Curse Spell Material Components
entries: All curse spells require "something from the target creature (such as blood, hair, or scales) which the spell consumes" as the material component. This can be satisfied by either by having that material, or being in range to touch the creature while casting the spell.

spell.name: Blackhole
entries: You creature a miniature black hole at a point within range. An event horizon forms in a 15-foot radius around the point, blocking anything (including light, sound, and magical effects) from passing through that space without being engulfed into the black hole.

When the black hole appears, creatures within 15 feet of the point must make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid being engulfed. On success, they move up their movement speed out of the event horizon of the black hole. If they cannot move a space outside of the event horizon, they automatically fail their save, and are engulfed.
